  • Experience with Mobile testing automation.
  • Forensic attention to detail.
  • Experience working on Agile/Scrum teams.
  • Meaningful experience working on large, complex systems.
  • Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon.
  • Ability to identify with the goals of FullStack's clients, and dedicate yourself to delivering on the commitments you and your team make to them.
What We Offer:
  • Competitive Salary.
  • Paid Time Off (vacation, sick leave, maternity and paternity leave, holidays).
  • 100% remote work.
  • The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies.
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance.
  • 401(k) w/ 4% match.
  • Virtual company events each month.
  • Ample opportunity for career advancement.
  • Continuing education opportunities.

FullStack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form, which can be provided upon request during our hiring and interview process.

title: 24I/BELO - Sales Executive
description:
Sales Executive – Belo Horizonte, Brazil (Job Ref: 24I/BELO)


Randox has an exciting opportunity for an ambitious, target driven individual to join our growing sales team in Belo Horizonte, Brazil.


The role will involve the promotion of the Randox brand and the sales of Randox Clinical products by focusing on existing customers and developing new customer.


The Role:

  1. Adherence to the Randox Sales Process.
  2. Preparation of sales reports and sales projects.
  3. Direct sales of Randox products to end-users and distributors.
  4. Management of key accounts.
  5. Based in Belo Horizonte with extensive travel throughout the assigned territory.
  6. Identify strategic market research for business opportunities in order to grow revenue in the region.
  7. Monitoring and updating of CRM tool as part of daily role.
  8. Setting up and manning of exhibitions and seminars.

Although a field role, the successful candidate will work with a team of staff based throughout Brazil.


Your profile:

  1. Essential to speak English.
  2. Experience within the Brazilian Diagnostic Market.
  3. Excellent communication and organisational skills.
  4. Ability to meet deadlines and prioritise working procedures.
  5. Proficiency in all Microsoft applications – Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
  6. Possess a full driving license.

Please ensure your application is submitted to us in English.


About Randox:

An international company operating in over 145 countries that continues to have unparalleled growth, Randox Laboratories has been the heartbeat of the UK’s National COVID Testing Programme throughout the pandemic. In early 2020 Randox recognised the threat from COVID-19 and, based on over 40 years of diagnostic experience, quickly developed a test to accurately identify the virus. Testing at scale commenced within weeks to support the UK’s National Testing Programme and private clients alike.

Additionally, as a world leader in diagnostics for clinical healthcare, toxicology and food security, our expertise and product portfolio have assisted laboratories across the world in improving health and saving lives. Our global success is a result of our pioneering products and the commitment & skill of our workforce, which continue to grow exponentially.

Central to the Randox ethos is our drive and determination to improve healthcare worldwide and every one of our talented staff play a role in this. In order to serve our growing international markets, we require high calibre applicants with scientific, engineering, software, and broader business skills – including sales, marketing, logistics, finance and many more. Join the Randox team and play your part in improving the health of millions.

  • Pacote office avançado (excel e power point).
  • Experiência com treinamento, contato com área comercial, ponto de venda, programas de loja perfeita.
  • Desejavel experiência em empresas de bens de consumo.

Informação adicional

Na JDE Peet's , acreditamos que é incrível o que acontece ao redor de uma xícara de café e de chá. Também acreditamos que uma cultura diversa e inclusiva nos permite servir a todos os amantes de café e chá da melhor maneira possível. 

Contamos com um programa de benefícios flexíveis em que você poderá personalizar seus benefícios de acordo com seu momento e estilo de vida. 

  • Assistência Médica;
  • Assistência Odontológica;
  • Previdência Privada;
  • Vale Alimentação;
  • Vale Refeição;
  • Desconto de Produtos;
  • Reembolso de pedágio;
  • Programa Grãos do Futuro (assistência e licença estendida para famílias gestantes e adotantes).

O futuro do trabalho é híbrido, no escritório e em casa desempenhamos um papel importante. Na JDE Peet's, valorizamos encontrar colegas no escritório para liberar as possibilidades de café e chá juntos e aproveitamos nosso tempo de foco quando trabalhamos em casa. Junte-se a nós e você experimentará ambos. Porque é incrível o que acontece ao redor de uma xícara de café.

#DesperteSuasPossibilidades #LI-Hybrid

A JDE Peet's é uma companhia global especializada em cafés e chás, com sede na Holanda. Desde 1753, a JDE se inspira na crença de que é incrível o que acontece ao redor de uma xícara de café.Nós despertamos possibilidades de café e chá em mais de 100 países com um portfólio de mais de 50 marcas.

No Brasil, somos a segunda maior empresa de café e temos atuação nacional com liderança absoluta em São Paulo e no Rio de Janeiro, conhecida através de suas marcas Pilão, L’OR, Café do Ponto, Caboclo, Damasco e Café Pelé. 

Como é trabalhar na JDE Peet's?

Somos pessoas unidas pelas possibilidades de chá e café. Na JDE Peet's, nós nos desenvolvemos com a liberdade de buscar oportunidades e de provocar novas ideias para causar grande impacto.

Nossa ambição é simples: despertar possibilidades de café e chá. 

Colocamos em prática nossas intenções, cumprindo o que foi acordado e sempre levando as coisas adiante. Oferecemos aos nossos associados uma série de programas de aprendizado e desenvolvimento para apoiar seu crescimento pessoal. Trabalhamos arduamente para construir um ambiente aberto e colaborativo, onde você possa se aproximar de qualquer pessoa e ser ouvido. 

Quando você cresce, nós crescemos e o café também.

Inscreva-se para despertar uma xícara incrível para sua carreira.

title: Pessoa Cientista de Dados - Modelagem de Crédito
description:
Pessoa Cientista de Dados - Modelagem de Crédito

Sobre o Bradesco
Pensamos em estratégias que sejam capazes de criar oportunidades para a realização das pessoas e para o desenvolvimento sustentável de empresas e sociedade. Ao longo de oito décadas, com pioneirismo e inovação, contribuímos com a democratização do acesso aos serviços bancários no Brasil e fomos além, nos tornamos um dos maiores grupos financeiros da América Latina.

Sobre a oportunidade
A equipe de Modelagem de Crédito tem responsabilidade pelo desenvolvimento de ferramentas analíticas (modelos, algoritmos, etc.) que sustentam todo o processo de decisão de crédito. Como cientista de dados de modelagem, será responsável pela construção, com regressão e machine learning, para manipulação e entendimento de dados baseados em modelos preditivos.

Suas atividades com a gente envolvem:

  1. Realização de estudos analíticos, trabalhando por grande volume de dados;
  2. Desenvolver modelos e algoritmos (regressão, Machine Learning, etc.);
  3. Apresentação dos resultados de estudos e modelos, por meio de relatórios técnicos e apresentações;
  4. Interagir com diversos departamentos internos, demonstrando interesse e vontade de aprender;
  5. Aplicação de melhores práticas compartilhadas pela liderança.

Para essa oportunidade você precisa:

  1. Ensino superior completo em Estatística, Matemática, Engenharias ou áreas correlatas;
  2. Experiência no desenvolvimento de soluções analíticas;
  3. Nível de conhecimento em estatística e Machine Learning;
  4. Nível de programação em SQL e Python/Spark, com uso de bibliotecas de ciência de dados (Pandas, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib, etc.);
  5. Nível de experiência com pacote Office (Excel, Word e Power Point);

Diferencial:

  1. Pós-graduação em áreas correlatas à ciência de dados;
  2. Experiência em desenvolvimento de modelos de risco de crédito;
  3. Experiência de programação em SAS;
  4. Sistemas de controle de versão (GitHub, Bitbucket, etc.);
  5. Experiência com metodologias ágeis de desenvolvimento;
  6. Inglês avançado.

O que nós oferecemos:

  1. Remuneração -> Aderente às melhores práticas de mercado;
  2. Saúde -> Plano de saúde, odontológico e seguro de vida, além de descontos em farmácias;
  3. Auxílios -> Refeição, alimentação e transporte;
  4. Previdência -> Plano opcional e exclusivo para funcionários, com participação financeira da Organização Bradesco;
  5. Bem-estar -> O programa interno Viva Bem Bradesco conta com diversas iniciativas para prevenção de doenças e promoção de hábitos, atitudes e comportamentos saudáveis, além de oferecer orientação e aconselhamento para resolução de problemas pessoais, familiares, legais e financeiros;
  6. Capacitação -> Por meio da Universidade Corporativa Bradesco, a Unibrad, investimos no aprendizado pessoal e profissional do nosso time, promovendo soluções de aprendizagem e parcerias com instituições de ensino;
  7. Isenção de tarifas -> Cesta de serviços bancários exclusiva, com descontos e condições especiais em diversos produtos e serviços da Organização Bradesco;
  8. Mães, Pais e Filhos -> Auxílio creche/babá, licença paternidade e licença maternidade estendida, além de acompanhamento assistencial da gestação até o pós-parto.

title: Delivery Manager - Remote - Latin America
description:
FullStack is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, and Stanford University build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential.

We’re most proud of:

  1. Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas.
  2. Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world’s greatest companies.
  3. Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users.
  4. Our 4.5-star rating on GlassDoor.
  5. Our client Net Promoter Score of 68, twice the industry average.
The Position:

We're looking to hire a Delivery Manager to join our team. You'll work with our incredible clients in one of two ways:

  • Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis.
  • Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack product team to build and deliver a product to our clients.
What We're Looking For:
  • 5+ years of experience as a Delivery Manager or in a similar role.
  • Experience in managing programs and projects from inception to successful delivery.
  • Experience overseeing OKRs.
  • Proven experience in developing frameworks to effectively manage, track, and report on initiatives, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and objectives.
  • Experience working on Agile/Scrum teams.
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate status, decisions, and key information to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
  • Develop strong, collaborative partnerships with key stakeholders spanning multiple disciplines.
  • Proficiency with Jira in a work environment.
  • Advanced English is required.
  • Successful completion of a four-year college degree is required.
  • Extensive background in team leadership.
  • Ability to identify with the goals of FullStack's clients, and dedicate yourself to delivering on the commitments you and your team make to them.
  • An understanding of best practices and a commitment to following them.
  • Forensic attention to detail.
  • Ability to consistently work 40 hours per week.
What We Offer:
  • Competitive pay in your local currency.
  • 100% remote work.
  • The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies.
  • English Classes.
  • Virtual company events each month.
  • Ample opportunity for career advancement.
  • Continuing education opportunities.
  • Depending on your location, other benefits may apply.

FullStack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. title: Backend Software Engineer Senior - Vaga afirmativa para mulheres
description:
Sobre nós

A ambição da Swile é criar um mundo de trabalho gratificante e transformar em prioridade a experiência do colaborador. Por isso queremos criar uma marca poderosa dentro do mundo do trabalho, no Brasil, na França e no resto do mundo.

Fundada em 2016 e reconhecida como uma das melhores empresas para trabalhar pelo GPTW (Great Place to Work 2020), a Vee se uniu à Swile, a mais inovadora ScaleUp europeia e que revolucionou o mercado de benefícios na França em 2021, se tornando um unicórnio global!

Sobre o time e a posição

Para quem gosta de melhoria contínua, essa vaga é para você. Essa pessoa desenvolvedora vai auxiliar nossos devs a otimizar nosso aplicativo atual (Swile by Vee), buscando integrar melhorar práticas, seja isso em uma linha ou na arquitetura do todo, a autonomia é a irmã da comunicação.

Ser Sr. Software Engineer na Swile é impactar positivamente a vida de nossos clientes e usuários tomando decisões com base em dados e garantindo a eficiência, estabilidade e performance de nossas aplicações. Ao traduzir as visões de produto para software, resolvemos problemas complexos que possibilitem uma experiência única, estável e funcional para todos.

Como backend engineers, atuamos em aplicações como REST APIs, dashboards, tools e serviços internos que possibilitam nossos clientes e usuários a usarem seus benefícios de forma flexível, fácil e disponível sempre que precisam.

Principais atividades no time

  1. Engenharia de Software
  • Produzir código de alta qualidade documentado, eficiente, testado e manutenível
  • Assegurar e melhorar observabilidade e monitoramento nas aplicações
  • Foco em melhorar aspectos técnicos de outros membros, padrões e qualidade geral do time proativamente
  • Aprender outras linguagens de programação se necessário
  • Ativamente focar em melhorar a segurança, performance, estabilidade das aplicações
  • Fazer (e receber) code reviews de qualidade para outros membros do time
  • Design e Arquitetura
    • Exercer influência técnica colaborando com discussões embasadas e visando soluções objetivas e simples
    • Propor soluções de arquitetura colaborando e orientando outros membros do time para garantir requisitos funcionais e não funcionais.
  • Execução e Resultado
    • Estimar e planejar timelines para entregas junto aos stakeholders e time de produto
    • Usar soluções existentes na Swile garantindo a convergência com as plataformas globais
    • Trabalhar com requisitos pouco definidos ou ambíguos para melhor definir soluções junto ao time de produto, stakeholders e outros membros do time
    • Criar soluções incrementais junto ao time de produto visando a melhoria e entrega contínua das suas aplicações
    • Focar em entregas testadas automatizadas e também E2E garantindo a estabilidade das aplicações
    • Monitorar e agir em incidentes das aplicações em produção
  • Liderança
    • Liderar projetos garantindo as entregas dentro das estimativas
    • Evoluir membros do time tecnicamente sendo um role model
    • Participar dos processos seletivos para engenheiros do mesmo level ou inferior
    Requisitos mínimos:
    • Bacharel em Ciências da Computação, Engenharia, áreas relacionadas ou experiência prática similar
    • Experiência profissional com engenharia de software em Java ou Kotlin
    • Experiência em arquitetura e desenvolvimento de sistemas distribuídos
    • Experiência com tecnologias como Redis, Kafka, RabbitMQ ou similares
    • Experiência com bancos de dados relacionais e não relacionais
    • Habilidade de comunicação clara e efetiva
    • Inglês Avançado/fluente
    Requisitos preferenciais:
    • Mestrado ou Doutorado em Ciências da Computação ou áreas relacionadas
    • Experiência com micro serviços e arquiteturas orientadas a evento
    • Experiência com gRPC, Protocol buffer ou similares
    Sobre nossos valores
    • We are team players: nós nos importamos com nossos colegas e navegamos bem entre áreas
    • We are doers: temos ano nível de autonomia e entregamos resultados tangível
    • We move fast: identificamos corretamente as prioridades e assumimos a iniciativa
    • We are ambassadors: entendemos sobre o mercado, o produto e estamos alinhados em torno da mesma visão
    • We stay hungry: somos resilientes e gostamos de aprender e compartilhar conhecimento
    • We cherish our values : abrimos mão do ego e aceitamos feedbacks como um presente
    O que oferecemos:
    • Pacote de benefícios flexíveis super atraentes para você usar como quiser (flexfood, mobilidade, cultura, educação, etc) dentro do cartão Swile;
    • Bônus
    • Auxílio Home-office
    • Plano de Saúde e Odontológico sem coparticipação;
    • TotalPass (acesso às melhores academias e estúdios)
    • Aulas de inglês ou Francês.
    • Auxilio farmária
    • Saúde emocional (sessões de terapia gratuitas com um de nossos parceiros)
    • New Value (desconto em mais de 1.100 lojas e restaurantes)
    • Trabalho Full Remoto

    Nós abraçamos e incentivamos a diversidade e inclusão no nosso time, então, sinta-se livre para ser quem você é junto à nós.

title: Gerente de Arquiteto Soluções - Inovação
description:
Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:

Date: Apr 29, 2024

Location: BAL - SEDE

Requisition Number: 33511

Bunge has an exciting opportunity available for a Solution Architect (Innovation). In this role, you will be part of a global team working on challenging, meaningful projects impacting core business activities. Since 1818, Bunge has been connecting farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed, and fuel to the world. Looking to the future, our ambition is to continuously reinvent ourselves, leveraging data to be at the forefront of analytics, technology, and talent to accomplish our purpose in a better, faster, and simpler way. Bunge is committed to operating and thriving in the digital world – creating world-class agile teams where teammates are empowered and encouraged to collaborate and test and learn to succeed.

At Bunge, people don’t just come here to work; they come here to grow – solving challenges that directly impact the world with a diverse team of thinkers and doers. Bunge offers a strong compensation and benefits package, generous paid time off program, flexible work arrangements, and opportunities to progress. Our hybrid work environment provides a balance of in-office and remote work.

Most importantly, in all we do we live our values:

  • Act as One Team by fostering inclusion, collaboration, and respect.
  • Drive for Excellence by being agile, innovative, and efficient.
  • Do What's Right by acting safely, ethically, and sustainably.

Overview:

We are looking for an experienced, highly technical, and innovative architect with a passion for emerging technologies to join the Enterprise Architecture & Technology Enablement team in the Business Technology (BT) organization. The "Gerente de Arquiteto Soluções - Inovação" will be at the forefront of the innovation strategy and will be responsible for designing cutting-edge innovation patterns and platforms that can be efficiently and securely scaled to unlock new business opportunities. In addition, this person will lead global squads for cutting-edge technology delivery while acting as the primary advisor for proofs-of-concept, proofs-of-value, and pilots. This role reports to the Technology Innovation Lead in the BT organization.

Essential Functions:

  • Design and develop innovative, scalable, efficient, and secure technical architecture and infrastructure for PoCs that address business challenges.
  • Introduce, test, and evaluate full-stack, reusable architecture patterns for technologies like AI, Blockchain, Metaverse, AR/VR, IoT, and robotics, and introduce automation for quickly creating new instances and environments.
  • Coordinate with other technical professionals – such as cloud engineers, security engineers, data engineers, and compliance officials – to ensure that all patterns adhere to Bunge’s Enterprise Architecture principles.
  • Routinely schedule and meet with critical external vendors and partners to stay on top of the latest technology trends and advancements and to understand best practices in the industry.
  • Serve as an experience leader capable of guiding teams on complex technical issues and as a mentor for junior teams.
  • Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences to inspire creativity and collaboration while fostering a culture of innovation within the organization.
  • Establish business cases and incubate new technologies. Collaborate with the leadership team to determine which new technologies to integrate into strategic 2–3-year roadmaps.
  • Identify and protect valuable intellectual property generated through research and development efforts through patent filings and licensing agreements to safeguard the organization's innovative ideas and developments.
  • Establish and evaluate Objectives & Key Results and performance metrics for technology innovation initiatives and provide regular reports to stakeholders.

Requirements:

The ideal candidate will have 7+ years of experience architecting secure, scalable, and efficient innovative prototypes and production solutions in several of the following technologies:

  • Artificial Intelligence (AI), including LLMs, Generative AI, machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing.
  • Blockchain technology, including distributed ledger technology, smart contracts, and consensus mechanisms.
  • Cloud computing, including infrastructure as a service (IaaS), platform as a service (PaaS), and software as a service (SaaS), and infrastructure as code (in particular Google Cloud Platform).
  • Internet of Things (IoT), including sensors, actuators, and data analytics.
  • 5G networks and edge computing.
  • Augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR).
  • Robotics and automation.
  • Cybersecurity, including encryption, authentication, and access control.
  • Data science and analytics, including statistics, predictive modeling, and optimization.
  • Design thinking and user experience (UX).

Also, experience in a few of the following innovation activities is a plus:

It would also be beneficial to understand IT governance structures and related topics.

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing, and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

Job Segment: Cloud, User Experience, Information Technology, IT Architecture, Solution Architect, Technology

title: Sr Software Engineer
description:
At Nexla, we’re a pioneer in automating data engineering with the mission to make ready-to-use data available to anyone, anywhere. Recognized as a Gartner Cool Vendor, Nexla is built on logical Data Products (Nexsets) at its core, resulting in a data platform that seamlessly offers multi-speed data integration, preparation, monitoring, and governance in a no-code/low-code interface Doordash, LinkedIn, Johnson & Johnson, and LiveRamp are among the many data-driven enterprises that trust Nexla for their mission-critical data.

The Opportunity

We are looking for an experienced Senior level Software engineer on the backend software team to architect, develop and deliver backend solutions for our customers. A successful candidate will be well versed in the core principles and practices of system architecture for cloud services and have hands-on experience in building high throughput and large volume handling software systems. This role will be focused on working on the core part of Nexla’s backend software which enables and runs the flows. This is part of a very small team and you’ll be expected to be resourceful, a selfless team player, and regularly go above and beyond your “day job”. The upside is unbound growth opportunities and a chance to design greenfield software that handles huge amounts of data.

This position is Remote but candidates are to be located in South America

Key Responsibilities

  • Design and develop solutions for backend software using Java
  • Work on large scale problems of Data Engineering and design software to handle huge amounts of data (both transient and persistent)
  • Be part of the on-call rotation for your team to provide support on software
  • Bring knowledge of new technologies into the team, that will make Nexla’s platform more efficient and robust for the product
  • Collaborate with additional Nexla technical resources in Product, engineering, CSM, support etc. to solve customer issues
  • Collaborate with other engineering teams (Backend, API, UI etc.) to work on projects together
  • Build and design tools to monitor our systems better

What You Bring to Nexla

  • Enthusiasm and curiosity to learn new technologies and software architectures
  • Min. 7+ years of platform and backend software development in mid size or large scale engineering organizations
  • Excellent communication skills - being able to connect the dots in the feature requirements to enable software development of those features
  • Deep understanding and recent hands on experience of high throughput and low latency systems written in JVM based languages (Java or similar backend languages)
  • Experience and understanding of working on backend infrastructure: Kubernetes, Kafka, Caches (Redis, Memcache), Databases and communication protocols (gRPC, REST)
  • Experience in working with various data formats (JSON, Parquet, Avro etc.)
  • Ability to write code in the programming languages (like Java, Python etc.), deep understanding on how APIs work, ability to write and optimize SQL
  • Ability to connect a customer’s specific business problems and Nexla’s solutions
  • Ability to work in a team environment with other engineers in the platform team and mentor other engineers on backend infrastructure and system architecture design patterns

Somos pessoas unidas pelas possibilidades de chá e café. Na JDE Peet's, nós nos desenvolvemos com a liberdade de buscar oportunidades e de provocar novas ideias para causar grande impacto.

Nossa ambição é simples: despertar possibilidades de café e chá.

title: Encargado de Soporte Informático Expertice-IT
description:
Full-Time Encargado de Soporte Informático

Buscamos para empresa de soluciones industrializadas de alta tecnología, ubicada en la zona norte de Santiago (Colina), el perfil de un Encargado de Soporte Informático.

Misión del cargo:

El Encargado de Soporte es responsable de brindar asistencia técnica y solucionar problemas relacionados con sistemas informáticos, software, hardware y redes. Su objetivo principal es garantizar la disponibilidad y el rendimiento óptimo de la infraestructura tecnológica de la organización y proporcionar un excelente servicio de atención al cliente interno o externo.

Funciones:

  • Resolución de problemas de hardware

- Diagnosticar y reparar fallas de hardware, como problemas con computadoras, impresoras, teclados, mouse, monitores, etc.

- Reemplazar componentes dañados o defectuosos.

- Instalar, desinstalar y actualizar software.

- Resolver errores y problemas de compatibilidad de software.

- Configurar aplicaciones y sistemas operativos.

- Ayudar con problemas de conectividad a internet o en redes locales.

- Diagnosticar y resolver problemas de conexión y rendimiento de red.

  • Asistencia técnica remoto

- Proporcionar soporte técnico a través de herramientas de acceso remoto.

- Guiar a los usuarios a través de procedimientos de resolución de problemas por teléfono, chat o videollamada.

  • Gestión de cuentas y acceso

- Ayudar con problemas de inicio de sesión y contraseñas.

- Configurar cuentas de usuario y establecer permisos y privilegios.

- Ayudar a configurar dispositivos como impresoras, escáneres, cámaras web, y otros periféricos.

- Sincronizar dispositivos móviles con computadoras o redes.

  • Soporte a dispositivos móviles

- Asistir con problemas relacionados con smartphones y tablet.

- Configurar cuentas de correo y aplicaciones en dispositivos móviles.

  • Gestión de incidencias y tickets de soporte

- Registrar, rastrear y gestionar tickets de soporte para asegurar la resolución eficiente de problemas.

- Documentar soluciones y problemas recurrentes para mejorar el soporte futuro.

  • Mantenimiento preventivo

- Realizar tareas de mantenimiento preventivo para prevenir problemas futuros, como limpieza de hardware y actualizaciones de software.

  • Colaboración con otros equipos

- Escalar problemas según sea necesario.

Beneficios del cargo: Aguinaldos Fiestas Patrias / Navidad.

Opción a Seguro Complementarios, pero valor prima compartida entre empleador y empleado.

El trabajo se realizará de forma 100% presencial en oficina ubicada en Colina.

Interesados que cumplan con los requisitos, favor enviar CV indicando pretensiones de renta, disponibilidad y referencias laborales a En asunto indicar: Encargado de Soporte Informático. Gracias!

Capacitamos e encorajamos nosso time para assumir riscos e desafios de forma não convencional para mudar vidas por meio da tecnologia.

Responsabilidades:

  • Trabalhar com equipes de desenvolvimento de software para reunir requisitos e garantir que as melhores práticas sejam seguidas.
  • Projetar, implementar e apoiar soluções para o desenvolvimento de aplicativos, segurança, análise e gerenciamento de desempenho.
  • Adequar-se aos padrões de codificação de segurança existentes da indústria e da Verizon, aderindo aos requisitos de verificação de fortificação e outras ferramentas de revisão de segurança.
  • Conduzir revisões de código para membros juniores da equipe e fazer revisões de código de colegas para garantir que o código esteja seguindo os padrões estabelecidos pelos arquitetos.
  • Executar scripts de teste com base no código para garantir a qualidade da entrega.
  • Resolver questões de código com urgência.

Habilidades e experiência desejadas

Requisitos essenciais:

  • 4+ anos de experiência no desenvolvimento em Java.
  • Experiência com bancos de dados SQL e NoSQL.
  • Experiência com Microservices e Nuvem.
  • Conhecimento avançado em algoritmos.
  • Conhecimento de infraestrutura de TI.
  • Gestão intermediária de metodologias ágeis.
  • Forte compreensão das melhores práticas, princípios SOLID, CLEAN Code e soluções escaláveis.
  • Conhecimento de Padrões de Design.
  • Nível avançado de inglês.

Requisitos desejáveis:

  • Experiência no desenvolvimento de aplicações inteiras a partir do zero.

Dettagli opportunità

Funzione:

Descrizione

Per gruppo internazionale, partner globale per le soluzioni integrate per la movimentazione logistica industriale, ricerchiamo una figura di Project & Development Manager.

Principali responsabilità

  1. Gestione delle commesse presso in cantieri: Supervisione e coordinamento dell’intero ciclo di vita delle commesse, dalla fase di preventivazione alla consegna finale.
  2. Collabora con i clienti per definire chiaramente i requisiti del progetto e garantisce la loro soddisfazione.
  3. Pianifica, programma e alloca risorse in modo efficiente per garantire il rispetto dei tempi e del budget.
  4. Monitorare costantemente lo stato di avanzamento delle commesse, risolvere eventuali problemi e mitigare i rischi.
  5. Analisi e gestione degli indicatori economici per raggiungere i risultati attesi.
  6. Organizzazione di riunioni e meeting periodici con i responsabili del cliente e del fornitore in modo di monitorare l’andamento del lavoro, compila report sui progressi svolti.

Principali caratteristiche richieste

  1. Avere competenze di base di contabilità comprese le procedure di fatturazione.
  2. Essere in grado di pianificare e monitorare il budget.
  3. Laurea in Ingegneria, Economia o esperienza tecnico commerciale consolidata.
  4. Conoscenza di base dei fondamenti di meccanica e oleodinamica e elettrotecnica.
  5. Esperienza comprovata nella gestione di commesse complesse di impianti.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: ACCOUNT MANAGER JR
description:
Our client is specialized in online advertising. It is an innovative provider of contextual video campaigns, with a unique targeting technology that can analyze and classify video content based on audio recognition. This allows user interest to be recognized in real time, enabling campaigns to be played on various platforms (YouTube, DailyMotion, local publishers, etc.). In this way, every user receives exactly the right advertising, and our customers (agencies and advertisers) receive the highest possible relevance and top KPIs.

ABOUT THE ROLE:

As an Account Manager, you will have the unique opportunity to work hands-on within the front lines of the online video advertising industry. Account Managers collaborate daily with the world's major interactive ad agencies, helping them achieve their marketing objectives. You will be responsible for a variety of customer-facing activities, including managing relationships with current clients and demand partners, as well as campaign management and optimization.

The successful candidate will be highly detail-oriented, well-organized, and able to work under tight deadlines while managing competing priorities.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:

  1. Analysis and recommendations for campaign performance improvements.
  2. Manage all day-to-day operations associated with assigned accounts.
  3. Manage internal tools for the task.
  4. Reception and verification of technical elements and creatives.
  5. Partial and final reports: Impact and reach studies, impressions, CTR, views, etc.
  6. Build direct, solid customer relationships from campaign launch to final report.
  7. Work closely with the Sales team and Traffic team for post-sales follow-up and upsales.
  8. Train new customers and introduce new features.

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

  1. Experience in online account management, online sales planning/buying, or ad networks is a plus.
  2. Detail-oriented with the ability to multi-task in a fast-moving start-up environment.
  3. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  4. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both English and Portuguese (Spanish is a plus).
  5. Commercial aptitude and the ability to converse clearly with clients.
  6. Proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
  7. Curious and motivated to learn and discover the industry.

BENEFITS:

Start-up culture: short communication channels, from intern to CEO.

#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Staff Game Engineer
description:
We're looking for a talented and passionate Staff Game Engineer to join Wildlife's Live Games Tech Team in Brazil .

As a Staff Game Engineer, you will report to the Technical Director of the game, and you'll play a key role in one of our largest live games, played by millions of people. As a staff engineer, you will participate in the full cycle of game development. You will make core decisions such as the overall software architecture and technology stack. However, you will not (only) act as a software architect. Additionally, you will be involved in the design and implementation of all other technical aspects of the game, such as gameplay mechanics, metagame logic and game world economy, both in the mobile app and in the server. You will guide other engineers of the technology team in solving their toughest technical challenges, collaborate with the project tech lead of the team to raise the technical bar of our projects, and disseminate your technical knowledge across the entire team. You won't have direct reports and will be an individual contributor, allowing you to have more time to go deeper into technical challenges.

We know that the work we do has a high impact on our company's success and culture. The right person for this position is curious by nature, and comfortable in a "take the initiative" environment, loves solving problems, and can thrive in a fast and growing business.

What you'll do

  • You will set overall software architecture of new game projects and new features;
  • You will collaborate with key technical decisions and validate the engineering projects for the game;
  • You will design software, implement, and write tests for metagame business logic on game app and services, including the development of APIs;
  • You will estimate engineering-related tasks making assumptions about dependencies and risks, and plan roadmaps, releases and sprints the team members;
  • Provide timely transparency of development status and risks to interested parties
  • Proactively look for problems in processes and propose improvements
  • You will help to solve the most challenging technical issues in the game, partnering with team members to solve them;
  • You will coach more juniors engineers to achieve technical excellence in the project;
  • You will identify inefficiencies in the current engineering way of working and propose systems, tools and/or processes that engineering managers need to put in place to solve them;
  • You will perform and collaborate to establish a strong engineering culture including processes like code review, pair programming, architecture reviews, automated tests coverage targets, etc..
  • You will ship new versions to production, supervise metrics and user feedback after the release;

What you'll need

  • 5+ years of software development professional experience;
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience;
  • Experience in handling large scale systems (several million users);
  • Plus: experience in the gaming industry, preferably in mobile gaming

More about you

  • You're passionate about software development and knows how to ensure its quality;
  • You're motivated by building up back-end services and is aware of its different architectures;
  • Experienced working in an environment which uses and stimulates DevOps culture;
  • You're creative when solving problems and is continuously seeking improvements for processes and solutions;
  • You can communicate clearly with your team and the company to identify issues and demands;
  • You have the autonomy to recognize the current and new priorities, evaluating the impact of their outcomes in the final result.

About Wildlife

Wildlife is one of the leading mobile game developers and publishers in the world. We have released more than 60 titles, reaching billions of people around the globe. Today, we have offices in Brazil, Argentina, Ireland, and the United States. Here, we create games that will excite, intrigue, and engage our players for years to come!

Equal Opportunity

Wildlife is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, colour, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

We're committed to providing accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process.

title: Assistant/Associate Director of Human Resources
description:
Why the American University of Iraq—Baghdad?

Opening its doors in January 2021, the new American University of Iraq—Baghdad (AUIB) began as a dream of influential individuals in Iraq and the United States in business, industry and government who wanted to see a world-class institution of higher learning established in the city, reminiscent of the days when Baghdad was an educational mecca and the flourishing capital of the Muslim world. With a great library, palatial college buildings and student centers, state-of-the-art classrooms, laboratories, and athletic facilities, AUIB will be a beautiful campus, attracting students, faculty, and staff from throughout the world.

This position will report directly to the Human Resources Director.

Position Summary

The Assistant/Associate Director of Human Resources has a key leadership role at the American University of Iraq in Baghdad. This position is responsible for overseeing various aspects of the HR department, ensuring effective collaboration among the team, and aligning HR strategies with the university’s mission and goals.

Key Responsibilities

Team Leadership and Management:

  • Provide support and direction to the HR team as it relates to the Talent Acquisition Manager, HR Analyst, Onboarding Specialist and other staff in the absence of the Human Resources Director.
  • Facilitate team meetings and ensure effective communication within the department.

Strategic HR Planning

  • Assist the Human Resources Director in developing and implementing HR strategies that support the overall objectives of the university.
  • Evaluate and improve HR processes and policies to enhance efficiency and compliance.
  • Complete a job analysis for future staffing needs, ensuring appropriate succession planning and career growth for employees.
  • Talent Acquisition and Management:
  • Oversee the recruitment process that the Talent Acquisition Manager and Coordinator are in charge of, making sure to attract and keep top talent.
  • Implement workforce planning and succession planning strategies.

Performance Management

  • Lead the development and execution of performance management systems.
  • Ensure regular performance reviews are conducted, and provide training and support to managers and staff in the process.

Training And Development

  • Coordinate with HR team members to identify training needs and develop training programs.
  • Promote a culture of continuous learning and professional development.
  • Compliance and Risk Management:
  • Work closely with the HR Compliance Coordinator to ensure adherence to local and international employment laws and regulations.
  • Oversee risk management in HR practices.

Employee Relations

  • Serve as a point of contact for employee relations issues.
  • Develop and maintain a positive work environment that promotes employee engagement and retention.

HR Analytics And Reporting

  • To use HR data for strategic decision-making, work together with the HR Analyst.
  • Prepare reports and presentations for senior management.

Payroll And Benefits Administration

  • Oversee payroll and benefits processes, ensuring accuracy and compliance.
  • Coordinate with the HR and Payroll Assistant to address any employee queries regarding payroll and benefits.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in human resources, business administration, or a related field. Master’s preferred with earned internationally recognized human resources certifications such as SHRM-SCP, SPHR or SHRM-CP, PHR.
  • At least 5 years of experience in HR with a minimum of 3 years in a management role.
  • Knowledge of HR best practices, Iraq employment laws, and regulations.
  • Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
  • Proficiency in HRIS systems and Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Must be fluent in Arabic and English

title: Non-Destructive Testing Engineer – Iraqi Nationals Only
description:
Non-Destructive Testing Engineer

How You Will Make An Impact

  • Perform specific calibrations, NDT and specific evaluations for acceptance or rejection of parts.
  • Accurate interpretation and understanding of the inspection checklist and work instruction.
  • Prepare and clean parts before and/or after inspection.
  • Prioritize, sort, and prepare the parts for NDT inspection, prepare and co-ordinate, load, unload and operate FPI, MPI, ET or UT line effectively.
  • Perform Ultrasonic Inspection, Fluorescent Penetrant Inspection, Eddy Current Inspection, Magnetic Particles Inspection in accordance with the inspection operation sheets.
  • Identify technical or schedule problems as they occur and take appropriate actions to resolve including escalation of more sophisticated issues to a higher level, providing authority advice and technical assistance to support staff and subordinate technicians.
  • Compile records to document condition of equipment and assure quality, providing required documentation and reports in accordance with the relevant standards and procedures.
  • Document findings in the relevant systems and co-ordinate swift response with relevant partners in engineering and back office if required.
  • Perform day-to-day activities as part of a team or as a stand-alone function and other duties as assigned.
  • Upkeep of NDT testing equipment to ensure its continuous operations in compliance with approved documents, standards, and calibration requirements including performance of scheduled maintenance of tooling and equipment.
  • Conduct audits in NDT area to ensure continuous system compliance to meet regulatory agencies requirements.
  • Supervise, guide, and use subcontractor NDT personnel to achieve project KPI’s in compliance with Siemens Energy guidelines as required.
  • Actively support outage preparation activities with project engineers, project managers, tooling facilities engineers, outage manager and HSE professional.
  • Maintain validity of qualification in accordance with ISO9712 and OEM standards.
  • Supervise, implement and/or support any other given specialist task during scheduled or unscheduled maintenance of Siemens Energy equipment as per cross-training and multiskilling concept of Field Service in AP and relevant capabilities.

What You Bring

  • Bachelor/Master of Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical and Process), 3 – 5 years’ experience in the relevant field of work is a plus.
  • Possess SE component specific NDT qualification and relevant working experience performing NDE on SE large rotating equipment (Gas Turbine, Generator and Steam Turbine) is an advantage.
  • Qualification and certification in accordance with ISO 9712 (preferable level 2 MT, PT, and UT).
  • Qualification and certification in accordance with Level 2 certification in either RT or ET is an additional advantage.
  • General understanding of technical equipment, wear, tear, and fatigue mechanisms of power generation equipment or in the Oil & Gas Industry and ability to work with/based on technical documentation.
  • Good general skills in mechanical maintenance activities of power generation equipment or in the Oil & Gas industry and willingness to continuously work hands-on under time pressure and in difficult conditions.
  • Digital literacy, confident user of relevant IT applications (Microsoft Office), additional IT competence will be advantageous.
  • Understanding of relevant industry standards for Quality and Health, Safety & Environmental protection.
  • Fluent in English Language (Written & Oral) and other languages are effective.
  • Strong analytical skills with an affinity to technology and innovation in the service industry combined with a proactive and convincing demeanor.
  • Great teammate with high level of resilience, the ability to work independently under pressure, multitask and focus on problem solving in a sophisticated environment collaborating with international teams.
  • Willing and legally able to work and travel independently and extensively to all Siemens Energy work locations and countries in Region Middle East.

title: Director of Enrollment Services – Expat
description:
Why the American University of Iraq—Baghdad?
Opening its doors in January 2021, the new American University of Iraq—Baghdad (AUIB) began as a dream of influential individuals in Iraqi and United States business, industry and government who want to see a world-class institution of higher learning established in the city, reminiscent of the days when Baghdad was an educational mecca and flourishing capital of the Muslim world. With a great library, palatial college buildings and student centers, state-of-the-art classrooms, laboratories, and athletic facilities, AUIB will be a beautiful campus, attracting students, faculty, and staff from throughout the world. We invite you to join us in this exciting new venture.

Position Title: Director of Enrollment Services

Position Summary : The Director provides high-level analysis of key performance indicators and helps devise and measure the success of the university’s enrollment strategy. He or she possesses a strong commitment to diversity, outstanding organizational skills, and the ability to execute the operational aspects of the enrollment management system. The DES works collaboratively with Marketing and Communications, the Registry, and the colleges to ensure the university reaches institutional enrollment goals while fostering a collaborative campus environment to build strong relationships with campus community stakeholders.

This position reports to the Vice President of Enrollment Services and Student Affairs.

Areas of Accountabilities: Main Activities

  1. Oversees and introduces admissions best practices into the enrollment management function and executes innovative enrollment strategies that align with the university’s mission and market trends.
  2. Provides leadership in the use of technology tools supporting recruitment and admission practices.
  3. Implements solutions that will support admissions generally, with a particular emphasis on the student experience of the admissions process.
  4. Collaborates with all stakeholders to implement and leverage effective admission strategies.
  5. Assists in the development of communication campaigns designed to enhance student recruitment.
  6. Develops reporting tools, strategies, and analytics from marketing and admissions data to help determine and analyze student recruitment trends to increase student enrollment.
  7. Develops robust training and development opportunities for admission operational staff members to develop and motivate a high-performing team.
  8. Attends the necessary training to remain fluent in the SIS and CRM system platforms.
  9. Represents the university as needed and evaluates how to continuously improve admissions strategies.
  10. Ensures compliance with university policies and procedures as well as international regulations related to admissions and enrollment.
  11. Creates and maintains a positive team environment, including but not limited to performance appraisals, professional development and training, and connections with other enrollment-related operational staff.
  12. Works closely with Student Services and campus stakeholders to implement retention strategies that support student success and engagement.
  13. Performs other relevant duties as assigned by the Vice-President of Enrollment Services and Student Affairs.

A: Educational Qualifications:

  1. Master’s degree in Education, Business Administration, or a related area field.

B: Minimum Experience:

  1. A record of demonstrated ability of 5-7 years of progressively responsible leadership experience in admissions, enrollment management, or a related field within higher education.
  2. Excellent computer systems skills, including web research fluency and the ability to learn and manage various information system technologies.

C: Competencies (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities):

  1. Well-versed and flexible in all aspects of the recruitment and enrollment cycle, and a familiarity with national and international trends and best practices in enrollment.
  2. Demonstrated ability to use technology to gather, interpret, analyze, and present data.
  3. Possess excellent interpersonal and strong team-building skills.
  4. Awareness of best practices and confidence in the use of modern admissions tools and trends.
  5. Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  6. Ability to prioritize and manage multiple responsibilities.
  7. Demonstrated success in meeting enrollment targets in a higher education setting or relevant setting.

Application Requirements for Positions at the American University of Iraq—Baghdad

Required

To be considered for any role at the American University of Iraq—Baghdad (AUIB), applicants are required to submit the following documents:

  1. Cover letter: This should detail how your skills and experience align with the specific requirements of the position you are applying for.
  2. Resume/Curriculum Vitae: Please provide an up-to-date resume or CV.
  3. Identification: A valid national ID or passport is required for the application process.
  4. Please note that applications missing any of these components will not be considered.

Shortlisted Candidates

If you are shortlisted for an interview, you will need to provide additional documentation:

  1. Educational transcripts and certifications must be translated into English.
  2. References: You must provide contact details for three references. These individuals should be those who have either worked with you or supervised your work.

We look forward to receiving your complete applications and appreciate your interest in joining our dynamic team at AUIB.

title: Especialista de Qualidade ao Cliente
description:
Descrição da vaga

  • Liderar projetos e processos nas 05 fábricas Brasil com foco em adequações a requisitos e melhoria contínua do sistema de Qualidade dos LSP (Logistic Service Providers) e Combiners.
  • Fazer a gestão das Reclamações de Consumidores Brasil, com forte relação e constante comunicação com as áreas de marketing, vendas, logística, customer service e manufatura, promovendo as análises de causa necessárias e melhoria contínua para evolução dos resultados.
  • Implementar em todos os centros de distribuição os requisitos legais, bem como os Globais, mantendo forte e constante contato com o último;
  • Garantir a implementação e fornecer suporte técnico as áreas de logística e customer service, nos assuntos relacionados a qualidade, segurança dos alimentos, padrões locais e globais da JDE e requisitos legais associados.
  • Fazer a gestão de todos os incidentes de Qualidade, necessidades de Recall ou recolhimento, bem como promover o Benchmarking de ocorrências de outras fábricas da JDE, trabalhando de forma proativa.
  • Desenvolver e conduzir treinamentos de formação e reciclagem de assuntos relacionados a qualidade e segurança dos alimentos para os associados das áreas de logística, atendimento ao consumidor, customer service e comercial.
  • Realizar visitas técnicas aos Clientes.
  • Auditar LSPs e Combiners de acordo com o processo global de homologação destes serviços.
  • Desenvolver e/ou revisar procedimentos e documentos do SGQSA ligados aos processos de Outbound.
  • Fazer a gestão de todos os processos de autuação, junto aos Órgãos Regulatórios (Anvisa, Inmetro).
  • Gestão de certificados e documentos necessários para Licitações, exportações e/ou comercialização de produtos JDE.

Qualificações

  • Superior completo em Engenharia de Alimentos, Química, Produção ou Administração com especialização em Alimentos.
  • Desejavel Certificações de Auditor Interno e Interpretação FSSC 22000.
  • Experiência na área de Qualidade em Indústria de Alimentos.
  • Conhecimento técnico em qualidade de produtos alimentícios e serviços com estatística básica, e ferramentas de Melhoria Contínua.
  • Construção e análise de Dashboards/KPIs.
  • Desejável experiência na área de logística, ou customer service com reclamações de consumidores e clientes em indústria de alimentos, especialmente na indústria do café.
  • Pacote Office – Excel Avançado e Power BI.
  • Inglês Intermediário a Avançado.
  • Disponibilidade para viagens.

Informações adicionais

  • Assistência Médica;
  • Assistência Odontológica;

  • Refeição no local;
  • Desconto de Produtos;
  • Programa Grãos do Futuro (assistência e licença estendida para famílias gestantes e adotantes).

Nossa declaração de Diversidade Equidade & Inclusão

Na JDE Peet's, nosso propósito é criar um futuro melhor, no qual servimos, refletimos e abraçamos todos em suas autenticidades. Acreditamos na promoção de uma organização mais diversa, equitativa e inclusiva, em que todos se sintam confortáveis para serem, verdadeiramente, quem são e possam despertar todo o seu potencial. Isto significa que não toleramos qualquer tipo de discriminação com base em raça ou etnia, identidade de gênero, orientação sexual, religião, nacionalidade, idade, deficiência ou qualquer outra característica diversa e protegida por lei.

Ao longo de todo o ciclo de vida dos associados, priorizamos DE&I no centro dos nossos processos de pessoas. Isso nos permite promover o respeito e eliminar qualquer preconceito ou ação discriminatória, garantindo uma experiência inclusiva no ambiente de trabalho. Não hesite em entrar em contato se precisar de qualquer suporte durante o processo de recrutamento.

#DesperteSuasPossibilidades #UmaXícaraIncrível 

Quem somos nós?

A JDE Peet’s é uma empresa líder mundial especializada em cafés e chás, sediada na Holanda e com uma história que começou em 1753. Despertamos possibilidades de café e chá em mais de 100 países com um portfólio de mais de 50 marcas, incluindo L’OR, Peet’s, Jacobs, Senseo, Tassimo, Douwe Egberts, OldTown, Super, Pickwick e Moccona.

No Brasil, somos a segunda maior empresa de café e temos atuação nacional com liderança absoluta em São Paulo e no Rio de Janeiro, conhecida através de suas marcas Pilão, L’OR, Café do Ponto, Caboclo, Damasco e Café Pelé.

Como é trabalhar na JDE Peet's?

Somos pessoas unidas pelas possibilidades de chá e café. Na JDE Peet's, nós nos desenvolvemos com a liberdade de buscar oportunidades e de provocar novas ideias para causar grande impacto.
Nossa ambição é simples: despertar possibilidades de café e chá.
Colocamos em prática nossas intenções, cumprindo o que foi acordado e sempre levando as coisas adiante. Oferecemos aos nossos associados uma série de programas de aprendizado e desenvolvimento para apoiar seu crescimento pessoal.
Na JDE Peet's, acreditamos que é incrível o que acontece ao redor uma xícara de café ou chá.

title: Técnico Segurança do Trabalho (2o turno)
description:
Técnico Segurança do Trabalho (2º turno)

Descrição da vaga

  • Contribuir na definição das estratégias locais de implementação das políticas de SHE da JDE, através do desenvolvimento de programas de gestão específicos, visando a eliminação, redução e gerenciamento dos riscos envolvidos;
  •  Participar ativamente dos processos de auditoria de Segurança, Saúde e Meio Ambiente, utilizando os protocolos de avaliação da JDE, com objetivo de suportar todas as áreas clientes;
  • Suportar tecnicamente a equipe de SHE (Segurança, Saúde e Meio Ambiente), através de treinamentos, visitas técnicas, benchmark de melhores práticas, visando o atendimento aos requisitos da JDE;
  •  Realizar a gestão de químicos no que tange SHE: FISPQs, NR-26, NBRs, GHS, Revisão/elaboração de Procedimentos;
  • Suportar o processo de gestão dos planos de ação para questões e problemas específicos de Proteção à Propriedade e risco de incêndio no que tange a Gestão de risco, analisando as ocorrências significativas e com possibilidade de repetição, visando criar soluções para eliminar, minimizar e gerenciar os riscos envolvidos;
  •  Estabelecer e manter canais de comunicação ativos com os níveis operacionais e táticos do time Corporativo que tenha interface com SHE, dos Setores operacionais e áreas de apoio (Manutenção, Facilities, Qualidade, Almoxarifados, Armazéns, Administrativo, utilizando dos recursos disponíveis pela JDE, grupos de discussão, interação entre áreas, visando a agilização das ações e soluções para problemas específicos de HSE (Segurança, Saúde e Meio Ambiente);
  •  Participar da elaboração e revisão de procedimentos de SHE, treinar a liderança do site para a Jornada de mudança de cultura;
  • Acompanhar indicadores, que auxiliem a implementação das políticas da JDE e melhorias nos sistemas de gestão de SHE;
  •  Adotar e promover as orientações quanto ao Meio Ambiente, Saúde e Segurança, demonstrando um compromisso e sensibilização nos impactos dos processos de produção e nas condutas exercidas, através de ações preventivas e corretivas, garantindo melhoria contínua das mesmas e aumento na utilização eficiente dos recursos;
  • Realizar o acompanhamento dos requisitos legais e suportar o time de SHE nas ações/recomendações + visão de lucratividade em projetos;
  • Participar do pilar de MA – manutenção autônoma do sistema de melhoria continua MOS (Semelhante ao TPM).

Qualificações

  • Curso Técnico em Segurança do Trabalho (com registro ativo);
  •  Inglês Intermediário (desejável);
  •  Preferível curso em Auditor Líder ISSO14001 e 45001;
  •  Conhecimentos em Segurança e Combate a Incêndio;
  •  Conhecimento em Brigada de Emergência;
  •  Conhecimento em Gestão de Mudanças (MOC) e Segurança de Processo (desejável)
  •  Conhecimento em implementações de Cultura de desempenho (desejável);

  •  Condução e gestão do processo de S&OE (curto prazo), executando a quebra das volumetrias acordadas em S&OP para a dinâmica semanal focada na materialização de abastecimento e faturamento;

title: Solutions Engineer, LATAM
description:
BitGo is the leader in digital asset financial services, providing institutional investors with liquidity, custody, and security solutions. Founded in 2013, BitGo pioneered the multi-signature wallet and is the first digital asset company to focus exclusively on serving institutional clients. Active in both centralized and decentralized finance, BitGo offers market leading trading, lending, and borrowing services through its prime brokerage services and acts as the custodian for WBTC, the leading global stablecoin for Bitcoin. In 2020, BitGo launched BitGo Portfolio and Tax, providing clients with a full-stack solution for digital assets. In 2018, it launched BitGo Trust Company, the first qualified custodian purpose-built for storing digital assets. BitGo processes approximately 20% of all global Bitcoin transactions, and supports over 800 coins and tokens. BitGo provides the security and operational backbone for more than 1500 institutional clients in 50 countries, including many regulated entities and the world’s top cryptocurrency exchanges and platforms. BitGo is backed by Goldman Sachs, Craft Ventures, Digital Currency Group, DRW, Galaxy Digital Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, and Valor Equity Partners.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead and drive technical and product aspects for pre and post sales activities such as product education, solution architecture, implementation, onboarding, delivery, etc.
  • Continuous client relationship management that includes understanding client’s business requirements, expectations and technical support
  • Collaboration and partnership with our Product Management and Engineering Teams contributing to development of new product features
  • Serve as the client advocate, providing feedback to internal teams
  • Provide clear understanding of client requirements for our Sales Team for and during their sales calls.

Skills & Experience:

We are looking for teammates who share and practice our values: open communication, transparency, taking ownership, and a high level of craftsmanship. We are looking for coworkers who share our vision and mission: deliver trust in digital assets.

Required :

  • 3-5+ years in an enterprise client facing technical role as Solutions Engineer, Sales Engineer, Solutions Architect, Integration Engineer, Implementation Manager, Technical Account Manager, Customer Success Manager or similar
  • Demonstrated understanding of technical subjects and concepts including web services and applications, PaaS, SaaS, APIs, SDKs, etc.
  • Previous experience in pre-sales and/or post-sales capacity
  • Strong experience with leading and managing client engagements and projects
  • RFx/ DDQ experience - working with other SMEs to formulate relevant responses
  • Extremely high professionalism - client and colleagues love working with you
  • Clear and effective verbal and written communication and comprehension
  • Ability to self-manage and use best professional judgment as needed
  • Very high interest in blockchain, cryptocurrencies and financial services and products.
  • Demonstrated professional proficiency in English, Spanish and/or Portugues
  • Bachelor’s degree in CS or related STEM field, or equivalent years of professional experience

Why Join BitGo?

Disrupting an industry takes vision, innovation, passion, technical chops, drive to deliver, collaboration, and execution. Join a team of great people who strive for excellence and personify our corporate values of ownership, craftsmanship, and open communication. We are looking for new colleagues who bring innovative ways of thinking and problem solving, and who want risks to be part of the team that changes the world’s financial markets.

Here are some of the benefits* of working at BitGo:

  • Competitive base salary, bonus and stock options
  • 100% company paid health insurance for employee, partner and dependents
  • Up to 4% 401k company match
  • Paid parental leave, Paid vacation
  • Free commuter/parking pass; 5 min from Caltrain
  • Free custom lunches, dinners and snacks 
  • Computer equipment and workplace furniture to suit your needs
  • Great colleagues and inspiring startup environment
  • *Benefits may vary based on location 

Cryptocurrencies are the most disruptive change the financial services industry has seen in years. Join us and you’ll be able to look back and say you were part of the team that transformed investing.

title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer - Remote - Latin America
description:
FullStack is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, and Stanford University build distributed software development teams and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential.

We’re most proud of:

  1. Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas.
  2. Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world’s greatest companies.
  3. Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users.
  4. Our 4.5-star rating on GlassDoor.
  5. Our client Net Promoter Score of 68, twice the industry average.
The Position:

We're looking to hire a Senior Ruby on Rails Developer to join our team. You'll work with our incredible clients in one of two ways:

  • Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis.
  • Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack product team to build and deliver a product to our clients.
What We're Looking For:
  • 5+ years of professional software development experience.
  • Advanced English is required.
  • Meaningful experience with Ruby on Rails.
  • Experience working with front-end technologies.
  • Experience working on Agile/Scrum teams.
  • Successful completion of a four-year college degree is required.
  • Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon.
  • Ability to identify with the goals of FullStack's clients and dedicate yourself to delivering on the commitments you and your team make to them.
  • Ability to consistently work 40 hours per week.
Benefits:
  • Competitive pay in your local currency.
  • 100% remote work.
  • The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies.
  • English Classes.
  • Virtual company events each month.
  • Ample opportunity for career advancement.
  • Continuing education opportunities.
  • Depending on your location other benefits may apply.

title: Master HVAC Technician – TS/SCI
description:
Job Category: Engineering and Technical Support

Time Type: Full time

Minimum Clearance Required to Start: TS/SCI

Employee Type: Regular-Long Term Assignment

Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10%

Type of Travel: Local

* * *

CACI is seeking a Master HVAC Technician to support our program in support to our mission critical client in Iraq.

What You’ll Get To Do

As the selected candidate, you will perform inspections on HVAC systems and components (e.g. heating units, building exhaust fans, ventilation units, etc.) to evaluate condition, identify necessary repairs and recommend or perform preventive maintenance. Cleans, lubricates, and repacks the working parts of the system.

More About The Role

  • Tracks performance of routine and preventative maintenance to ensure availability of HVAC systems and troubleshoot HVAC/R systems with complex problems and extensive repairs requiring judgement to locate malfunctions.
  • Respond to service calls and preventive maintenance inspections and produce reports in writing through computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) regarding malfunctioning/inoperable equipment.
  • Responds to emergency situations during and after hours to resolve issues. Diagnoses causes of problems and/or failures in HVAC systems for the purpose of identifying equipment and/or systems repair and/or replacement needs.
  • Install, repair, and maintain large commercial and industrial ventilation, refrigeration, air conditioning (AC), and cooling systems with complex problems and extensive repairs.
  • Independently perform recurring work on exhaust fans, boilers, air handlers, pump, motors, air dryers, and other related HVAC equipment but not limited to HVAC control and monitoring systems.
  • Installs, modifies, overhauls, repairs, and maintains a variety of complex HVAC equipment air conditioning, air handlers, pumps, motors, valves, heating systems, and associated auxiliary and control equipment.
  • Works with engineering or scientific personnel to discuss plans, modifications, and user needs. Reviews available plans, specifications, or drawings; determines the size, shape, and location of equipment.
  • Performs design, modification, maintenance and repair of critical environmental and energy support systems and associated highly sensitive state-of-the-art computerized controls and air quality monitoring systems located within US-Only areas of Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM) Sensitive Compartmented Information Facilities (SCIFs).
  • Produces classified technical documentation outlining in depth technical findings and recommendations.
  • Provides design, emergency non-routine fault isolation of smoke removal systems, fire detection/suppression equipment used exclusively in critical, highly sensitive Military Forces installations.
  • Performs system and subsystem diagnostics and scheduling and maintaining complex electronic environmental systems, calibration, and lubrication of unique components and controls that are used to provide and monitor precise environmental conditions within SCIFs housing unique military intelligence equipment, scientific devices, and technologies.
  • Performs periodic, worldwide deployments in strategic and tactical mobile facility environments. Provides expert technical assistance for a 24-hour operational environment with limited documentation resources.
  • Responds to off-duty (evening and weekend) calls to support critical system outages and to provide rapid fault isolation and resolution concerning environmental factors affecting ISR system performance to include developing technical documentation for ISR support system layouts.
  • Supports US Army systems on site whenever and wherever deployed. Available to deploy to other countries and/or theaters to perform quick reaction technical support to US forces worldwide military contingency missions and requirements in potentially hazardous work environments.
  • Able to maneuver in small spaces and lift up to 50lbs.

You’ll Bring These Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree and three years of experience College, Vocational School, or High School diploma or equivalent and a combination of 10 years’ education and experience with a valid Master HVAC license, or equivalent, at a State level; or 12 years’ experience in an equivalent Military HVAC training/certification.
  • Specific experience in fault isolation and resolution of tactical and strategic environmental systems and their sophisticated electronic support systems.
  • Ability to plan, install, troubleshoot and repair equipment and systems not fully covered by technical manuals, schematics, etc.
  • 4 years’ experience with HVAC control and monitoring systems and their components.
  • Experience with computerized maintenance management systems (CMMS).
  • Expert level experience in design, installation and sustainment of computer controlled environmental systems in mobile secure facilities.
  • Required to meet US Government accepted and industry standards criteria for technically complex computer environmental systems, uninterrupted power distribution systems, and power control equipment.
  • Possess a North American Technician Excellence (NATE) certification.
  • US Citizen. Active TS/SCI clearance REQUIRED.

What We Can Offer You

  • We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.
  • Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.
  • We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.
  • We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities.
  • For over 60 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success.

Company Overview

CACI is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.

Pay Range : There are a host of factors that can influence final salary including, but not limited to, geographic location, Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant prior work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, and certifications. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and learning and development opportunities. Our broad and competitive mix of benefits options is designed to support and protect employees and their families. At CACI, you will receive comprehensive benefits such as; healthcare, wellness, financial, retirement, family support, continuing education, and time off benefits. Learn more here.

The Proposed Salary Range For This Position Is

$47,100-$96,500
