title: Líder (Gerente) de Unidade.
description:
Grupo Ultra

A Ultra já nasceu acreditando que o esporte e a atividade física são capazes de transformar nós mesmos, o outro e também a sociedade.

Todos nós temos o poder de fazer a diferença. E se o mundo está tão diferente por que as academias são todas iguais?

Chegamos para fazer diferente.

Propósito

Existimos para ser uma ferramenta poderosa de transformação através de atividades física e esportes. Nascemos como um agente incansável de mudanças, incentivando, motivando e oferecendo a estrutura e serviços adequados para a prática de exercícios.

Responsabilidades e Atribuições do cargo

  1. Supervisionar e coordenar a equipe e atividades da unidade
  2. Elaborar relatórios e atualizar relatórios com os indicadores e performance da unidade
  3. Monitorar os indicadores de desempenho da unidade e avaliar a equipe de forma coletiva e individual
  4. Participar, acompanhar e solucionar (quando possível) os itens avaliados em auditorias internas
  5. Realizar reuniões periódicas com a equipe (consultor de vendas, consultor fitness, coach de ginástica, limpeza e manutenção)
  6. Acompanhar obras de reparo e equipes de manutenção, tanto como predial, equipamento e limpeza.
  7. Fazer pesquisa na região com os concorrentes
  8. Capacitar e desenvolver todos os membros da equipe e de outras unidades.
  9. Aplicar treinamento inicial e de reciclagem com novos membros e equipe já existente
  10. Tratar e responder todas as manifestações vindas NPS, SAC, Site e Redes Sociais ou pessoalmente dos alunos, ouvindo, avaliando e decidindo com imparcialidade
  11. Tratar e solucionar os conflitos com os alunos.
  12. Supervisionar o atendimento de toda a equipe
  13. Controlar o estoque e suprimentos para unidade
  14. Coordenar toda a manutenção predial e de equipamentos, solicitar orçamentos e pesquisar melhores preços
  15. Entrevistar e selecionar pessoas para fazer parte da equipe (quando necessário)
  16. Participar do processo de admissão de novos membros, receber e conferir os documentos admissionais dos membros aprovados e enviar para contabilidade
  17. Gerenciar o ponto eletrônico da unidade
  18. Auxiliar no processo administrativo da unidade, como admissão, demissão, férias, faltas, marcação de ponto, escala de trabalho, fechamento da folha, etc.
  19. Zelar pela perfeita conservação, limpeza, proporcionando ordem no local de trabalho.
  20. Executar outras tarefas correlatadas, conforme necessidade do serviço e orientação do superior imediato.

Grau de Instrução

Ensino superior em Educação Física, Administração, Gestão de Negócios ou Pessoas.

Habilidades

Boa comunicação, liderança, tratamento igualitário, planejamento e organização, pontual, gostar de trabalhar com pessoas.

Pacote Office intermediário, gestão de pessoas.

Plano Vip Ultra para o colaborador e mais uma pessoa.

title: ENGINEERING MANAGER
description:
Our client is a venture-backed fintech with a mission to give employees instant access to their earned wages, which solves a major problem for real people, while killing predatory financial products like payday loans. It is the fastest-growing startup in the category and was incubated by QED Capital, a top fintech venture fund.

The company’s app provides earned wage access for employees at mid- to large-sized organizations to improve their financial wellness and to increase employee engagement and productivity. With many workers living paycheck to paycheck, financial wellness tools are an important part of any employee benefits package. The company gives employees access to the money that they have already earned whenever they need or want it, without needing to wait for the month-end paycheck. The service is mobile app-based, very easy and intuitive to use. There’s a small transaction fee and no interest to pay - a much healthier solution than payday loans or bank overdrafts with their exorbitant charges.

The company’s ultimate mission is to help people attain financial freedom, which starts with giving people full control over their income.

ABOUT THE ROLE:

We are looking for an experienced Engineering Manager, that can lead a set of teams in their Engineering organization, being a technical reference for their engineers, helping them to succeed and grow professionally. We want someone that can have a holistic approach to technology.

You will be working closely with each Tech Lead in one or more tribes, and also with other Engineering Managers to help our client deliver exciting new products and features connected to their product roadmap vision. You will also be working closely with channel partners, helping the client to connect with vendors that are critical to their success, in areas like payments, payroll processing and time & attendance systems. Also, you will be required to work closely with their Product organization and Operations teams in multiple geographies, notably the US, India and the EU.

The ideal candidate will embrace the team’s global culture, which is rooted in Shokunin - the Japanese philosophy of giving your very best for the general welfare of people. The company’s other core values are radical transparency and zero ego.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES

  1. Lead teams to deliver on projects and programs around our business needs.
  2. Collaborate with other leads to break down complex deliveries in smaller pieces and iterate.
  3. To be a high level technical reference across several teams, guiding and supporting the team on important architectural decisions.
  4. Optimize cross team collaboration.
  5. Define and execute recruiting and onboarding strategy.
  6. Ensure their development process is followed and refined.
  7. Provide structured feedbacks and career growth.
  8. Communicate and influence in the prioritization of tech backlog.
  9. Define and implement new processes for enhanced productivity.
  10. Promote collaboration and engagement across teams.
  11. Coach and train Tech Leads and other technical references.

WORK EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS:

  1. 5+ years of experience in engineering management.
  2. 10+ years of experience in software engineering.
  3. Experience with early stage software products, taking products from a nascent stage to a higher level of maturity.
  4. Experience translating technical requirements and concepts to different audiences.
  5. Exceptional and proven written and verbal communication skills.
  6. Holistic technical and architectural vision, with previous development experience.
  7. Ability on designing, delivering and operating distributed cloud based solutions at scale.
  8. Flexible work style comfortable in a fast moving, high energy and evolving environment.
  9. Excellent project management, planning and organizational skills.
  10. Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines while paying attention to details.
  11. Ability to work effectively under pressure, time constraints and ambiguity.
  12. Flexible and able to adapt quickly to new situations.
  13. Ability to handle multiple (sometimes conflicting) priorities and still meet deadlines.

  7. Manter-se atualizado sobre as últimas tendências e mudanças nas plataformas de publicidade.

Requisitos:

  • Experiência comprovada em criação e gestão de campanhas Google Ads e Meta Ads.
  • Conhecimento avançado de ferramentas de análise e otimização de campanhas.
  • Habilidade em interpretar dados e métricas para tomada de decisões estratégicas.
  • Capacidade de trabalhar em equipe e gerenciar múltiplas campanhas simultaneamente.
  • Certificações em Google Ads e Facebook Blueprint são um diferencial.
  • Habilidades de comunicação e apresentação.

#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Técnico Segurança do Trabalho (2o turno)
description:
Técnico Segurança do Trabalho (2º turno)

Descrição da vaga

  • Contribuir na definição das estratégias locais de implementação das políticas de SHE da JDE, através do desenvolvimento de programas de gestão específicos, visando a eliminação, redução e gerenciamento dos riscos envolvidos;
  •  Participar ativamente dos processos de auditoria de Segurança, Saúde e Meio Ambiente, utilizando os protocolos de avaliação da JDE, com objetivo de suportar todas as áreas clientes;
  • Suportar tecnicamente a equipe de SHE (Segurança, Saúde e Meio Ambiente), através de treinamentos, visitas técnicas, benchmark de melhores práticas, visando o atendimento aos requisitos da JDE;
  •  Realizar a gestão de químicos no que tange SHE: FISPQs, NR-26, NBRs, GHS, Revisão/elaboração de Procedimentos;
  • Suportar o processo de gestão dos planos de ação para questões e problemas específicos de Proteção à Propriedade e risco de incêndio no que tange a Gestão de risco, analisando as ocorrências significativas e com possibilidade de repetição, visando criar soluções para eliminar, minimizar e gerenciar os riscos envolvidos;
  •  Estabelecer e manter canais de comunicação ativos com os níveis operacionais e táticos do time Corporativo que tenha interface com SHE, dos Setores operacionais e áreas de apoio (Manutenção, Facilities, Qualidade, Almoxarifados, Armazéns, Administrativo, utilizando dos recursos disponíveis pela JDE, grupos de discussão, interação entre áreas, visando a agilização das ações e soluções para problemas específicos de HSE (Segurança, Saúde e Meio Ambiente);
  •  Participar da elaboração e revisão de procedimentos de SHE, treinar a liderança do site para a Jornada de mudança de cultura;
  • Acompanhar indicadores, que auxiliem a implementação das políticas da JDE e melhorias nos sistemas de gestão de SHE;
  •  Adotar e promover as orientações quanto ao Meio Ambiente, Saúde e Segurança, demonstrando um compromisso e sensibilização nos impactos dos processos de produção e nas condutas exercidas, através de ações preventivas e corretivas, garantindo melhoria contínua das mesmas e aumento na utilização eficiente dos recursos;
  • Realizar o acompanhamento dos requisitos legais e suportar o time de SHE nas ações/recomendações + visão de lucratividade em projetos;
  • Participar do pilar de MA – manutenção autônoma do sistema de melhoria continua MOS (Semelhante ao TPM).

Qualificações

  • Curso Técnico em Segurança do Trabalho (com registro ativo);
  •  Inglês Intermediário (desejável);
  •  Preferível curso em Auditor Líder ISSO14001 e 45001;
  •  Conhecimentos em Segurança e Combate a Incêndio;
  •  Conhecimento em Brigada de Emergência;
  •  Conhecimento em Gestão de Mudanças (MOC) e Segurança de Processo (desejável)
  •  Conhecimento em implementações de Cultura de desempenho (desejável);

Informações adicionais

Na JDE Peet's , acreditamos que é incrível o que acontece ao redor de uma xícara de café e de chá. Também acreditamos que uma cultura diversa e inclusiva nos permite servir a todos os amantes de café e chá da melhor maneira possível.

Contamos com um programa de benefícios flexíveis em que você poderá personalizar seus benefícios de acordo com seu momento e estilo de vida.

  • Assistência Médica;
  • Assistência Odontológica;
  • Previdência Privada;
  • Vale Alimentação
  • Refeição no Local;
  • Desconto de Produtos – Grêmio JDE;
  • Cartão multibenefícios;
  • Reembolso de pedágio;
  • Programa Grãos do Futuro (assistência e licença estendida para famílias gestantes e adotantes).

A JDE Peet's é uma companhia global especializada em cafés e chás, com sede na Holanda. Desde 1753, a JDE se inspira na crença de que é incrível o que acontece ao redor de uma xícara de café. Nós despertamos possibilidades de café e chá em mais de 100 países com um portfólio de mais de 50 marcas.

No Brasil, somos a segunda maior empresa de café e temos atuação nacional com liderança absoluta em São Paulo e no Rio de Janeiro, conhecida através de suas marcas Pilão, L’OR, Café do Ponto, Caboclo, Damasco e Café Pelé.

Como é trabalhar na JDE Peet's?

Somos pessoas unidas pelas possibilidades de chá e café. Na JDE Peet's, nós nos desenvolvemos com a liberdade de buscar oportunidades e de provocar novas ideias para causar grande impacto. 

Nossa ambição é simples: despertar possibilidades de café e chá.

Colocamos em prática nossas intenções, cumprindo o que foi acordado e sempre levando as coisas adiante. Oferecemos aos nossos associados uma série de programas de aprendizado e desenvolvimento para apoiar seu crescimento pessoal. Trabalhamos arduamente para construir um ambiente aberto e colaborativo, onde você possa se aproximar de qualquer pessoa e ser ouvido.

Quando você cresce, nós crescemos e o café também. 

Inscreva-se para despertar uma xícara incrível para sua carreira.

#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Especialista de Qualidade ao Cliente
description:
Descrição da vaga

  • Liderar projetos e processos nas 05 fábricas Brasil com foco em adequações a requisitos e melhoria contínua do sistema de Qualidade dos LSP (Logistic Service Providers) e Combiners.
  • Fazer a gestão das Reclamações de Consumidores Brasil, com forte relação e constante comunicação com as áreas de marketing, vendas, logística, customer service e manufatura, promovendo as análises de causa necessárias e melhoria contínua para evolução dos resultados.
  • Implementar em todos os centros de distribuição os requisitos legais, bem como os Globais, mantendo forte e constante contato com o último;
  • Garantir a implementação e fornecer suporte técnico as áreas de logística e customer service, nos assuntos relacionados a qualidade, segurança dos alimentos, padrões locais e globais da JDE e requisitos legais associados.
  • Fazer a gestão de todos os incidentes de Qualidade, necessidades de Recall ou recolhimento, bem como promover o Benchmarking de ocorrências de outras fábricas da JDE, trabalhando de forma proativa.
  • Desenvolver e conduzir treinamentos de formação e reciclagem de assuntos relacionados a qualidade e segurança dos alimentos para os associados das áreas de logística, atendimento ao consumidor, customer service e comercial.
  • Realizar visitas técnicas aos Clientes.
  • Auditar LSPs e Combiners de acordo com o processo global de homologação destes serviços.
  • Desenvolver e/ou revisar procedimentos e documentos do SGQSA ligados aos processos de Outbound.
  • Fazer a gestão de todos os processos de autuação, junto aos Órgãos Regulatórios (Anvisa, Inmetro).
  • Gestão de certificados e documentos necessários para Licitações, exportações e/ou comercialização de produtos JDE.

Qualificações

  • Superior completo em Engenharia de Alimentos, Química, Produção ou Administração com especialização em Alimentos.
  • Desejavel Certificações de Auditor Interno e Interpretação FSSC 22000.
  • Experiência na área de Qualidade em Indústria de Alimentos.
  • Conhecimento técnico em qualidade de produtos alimentícios e serviços com estatística básica, e ferramentas de Melhoria Contínua.
  • Construção e análise de Dashboards/KPIs.
  • Desejável experiência na área de logística, ou customer service com reclamações de consumidores e clientes em indústria de alimentos, especialmente na indústria do café.
  • Pacote Office – Excel Avançado e Power BI.
  • Inglês Intermediário a Avançado.
  • Disponibilidade para viagens.

Informações adicionais

Contamos com um programa de benefícios flexíveis em que você poderá personalizar seus benefícios de acordo com seu momento e estilo de vida.

  • Assistência Médica;
  • Assistência Odontológica;

  • Refeição no local;
  • Desconto de Produtos;
  • Programa Grãos do Futuro (assistência e licença estendida para famílias gestantes e adotantes).

Nossa declaração de Diversidade Equidade & Inclusão

Na JDE Peet's, nosso propósito é criar um futuro melhor, no qual servimos, refletimos e abraçamos todos em suas autenticidades. Acreditamos na promoção de uma organização mais diversa, equitativa e inclusiva, em que todos se sintam confortáveis para serem, verdadeiramente, quem são e possam despertar todo o seu potencial. Isto significa que não toleramos qualquer tipo de discriminação com base em raça ou etnia, identidade de gênero, orientação sexual, religião, nacionalidade, idade, deficiência ou qualquer outra característica diversa e protegida por lei.

#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Mechanical Instructor
description:
Job Description Wood is currently recruiting for a Mechanical Instructor with a strong understanding of operations training requirements to be based in Basra, Iraq on a 28 Days on / 28 Days Off Rotation.

Responsibilities

Instructor Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Prepare training programs and manage presentation materials / equipment.
  • Perform Gap analysis on the competency level of the company workforce and develop a training program closing the gaps as per the company competency level requirements.
  • Deliver training efficiently with strong focus on Oil & Gas assets.
  • Present training material in a professional, interesting, and stimulating manner
  • Develop and publish different levels of training programs to satisfy the company needs which include Classroom and OJT activities.
  • Deliver Individual competency development training with a holistic approach which includes SHE and WMS considerations in accordance with the client and Iraq government regulations as well as industry systems as applicable.
  • Assess the students’ capabilities and modify program material / presentation as needed to maximize the student’s learning’s.
  • Maintain program performance, completion, attendance, evaluation records and perform LMS data input functions as defined by the client Training Management.
  • Interface and coordinate training activities with the Company, and other personnel to effectively achieve program presentations and completion objectives.
  • Ensure all students engage positively in learning experience.
  • Assist and encourage students who experience difficulties.
  • Assess student’s capabilities and modify program presentation as needed to maximize students’ learning’s.
  • Maintain program performance, completion, attendance, evaluation records and perform LMS data input functions as defined by client HR Training Management
  • Operate training facilities instructional and presentation equipment.
  • Ensure all developed training material is presented for archiving by the Document Controller.

Craft Assessment & Responsibilities

  • Work with Training Supervisor and Discipline Superintendent to establish/review assessment criteria.
  • Conduct assessments on O&M personnel to establish gaps in craft competencies.
  • Conduct assessments in a professional, interesting, and stimulating manner.
  • Ensure all students engage positively in assessment experience.
  • Assist and encourage students to provide evidence of prior formal training and previous work experience.
  • Modify assessment process as needed to maximize students’ involvement.
  • Maintain up to date records of all assessments planned and completed.
  • Ensure all developed assessment material is presented for archiving by the Document Controller

Qualifications

Education : University Degree: Any discipline & Accredited Assessor license

Technical Skills Required

  • Strong oil & gas upstream operational, technical, or supervisory background
  • Knowledgeable of / competent with basic upstream oil & gas operational programs
  • Competent / experienced with upstream oil & gas and craft training programs.
  • Strong training presentation, coordination, evaluation, & planning skills
  • Competent computer skills; presentation, spreadsheets, document preparation
  • Proven competence with procedure development and presentation software
  • Has proven ability to communicate technical information and procedures to students of varying levels

Personal Skills

  • A minimum of 10 years in a similar role with 5 years’ experience OJT / Classroom Training.
  • Minimum of 10 years of experience in Upstream and Downstream businesses.
  • Preferably holds an accredited Assessor Qualification.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Good interpersonal skills, able to work in multi-culture and multi-company environments.
  • Bi-Lingual (English / Arabic) ability preferred but not required.

description:

Resumo da vaga

Supply Leader

Atividades - Preparar a escolha dos produtos para o praticante de Surf e/ou Natação no país:
  • Participar na escolha dos produtos mais adequados à prática do esporte;
  • Garantir que os cadastros de produtos sejam feitos pela matriz;
  • Conectar os atores da cadeia de abastecimento: loja, site, armazém, importação, produção Brasil e mundo, fornecedores locais e equipes das marcas na matriz, para otimizar os processos e resultados.
Atividades - Disponibilizar os produtos nas lojas do país, otimizando os recursos da cadeia de abastecimento nacional e internacional:
  • Definir as previsões de vendas e de compras, para garantir a disponibilidade dos produtos em todas as lojas do país;
  • Negociar condições de abastecimento (prazos e custos) com os fornecedores locais e internacionais das nossas marcas.
Atividades - Participar da estratégia comercial com as lojas e consolidar os resultados econômicos no país:
  • Atingir os resultados através do uso das melhores condições de abastecimentos;
  • Desenvolver estratégias comerciais com as lojas;
  • Rentabilizar o estoque com o orçamento disponível, para garantir os melhores preços de venda possíveis aos nossos clientes.
Formação e Perfil:
  • Interesse na prática de Esporte de Água (Natação, Surf, Vela, Remo);
  • Ensino Superior Completo;
  • Inglês Fluente;
  • Domínio da ferramenta Excel;
  • Desejável experiência na parte administrativa;
  • Capacidade analítica e resolutiva;
  • Organização eficiente, foco e produtividade;
  • Ambição na construção de resultados e carreira profissional;
  • Dinâmico, facilidade para trabalhar em equipe.

#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Senior Engineer - Electrical - Natural Resources, Rio de Janeiro
description:
• Full-time
  • Department: Energy and natural resources

Company Description

At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.

Every day we help our major global clients deliver ambitious and highly technical projects in over 118 offices in 50 countries worldwide.

Our team is dynamic, innovative and client focused. Our clients value our proactive approach, depth of expertise, integrity and the quality we deliver. As a result, our people get to work on some of the most exciting projects in the world.

Job Description

The professional will take responsibility for effectively delivering a range of tasks to high quality standard and aid on a wide range of projects of all sizes and dimensions.

Handles commissions of varying sizes, depending upon the complexity of the project. Can work as part of a larger team or as the key day-to-day contact point with the client.

The Senior Engineer - Electrical is responsible for analyzing electromechanical and special installations verifying that they are aligned with technical specifications and the country's legislation norms, elaborating and controlling reports and monitoring the qualification of contractor craftsmen, recommending improvement actions, while being directly involved in day-to-day work site monitoring.

Qualifications

  • 10 years professional experience with a minimum of 7 years’ experience working as a Engineer coordinating MEP design and construction.
  • Bachelor´s Degree in Electrical Engineering
  • Experience with Electrical, HVAC, Plumbing, Fire Protection and Automation Systems
  • Commissioning experience is required.
  • PMI certification is a plus.
  • Experience in LEED projects is a plus.
  • Fluent in English to be able to lead project team meetings, issue written communications, minutes and reports, lead client meetings.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Project, Primavera P6, AutoCAD and BIM.
  • Microsoft Office Package.

Additional Information

Our inspired people share our vision and mission. We provide a great place to work, where each person has the opportunity and voice to affect change.

We want our people to succeed both in work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance.

Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.

title: Especialista de Infraestrutura (Projetos)
description:
Atividades:

  • Administrar Servidores Windows e Linux, Virtualização (cerca de 1000) - Vmware e Hyper-V, HP, Hitachi, Blades e Backup - Netbackup.
  • Imprescindível vivência técnica com projetos de infraestrutura.
  • Prover 3º nível de suporte para usuários internos em: Hardware, Software, Telefonia e Citrix.
  • Administração das rotinas de Backup utilizando ferramenta Netbackup.
  • Atuar na compra de servidores, dispositivos de Rede e itens relacionados a Infraestrutura.
  • Elaborar documentação da infraestrutura de TI.
  • Efetuar monitoração do ambiente de produção em linha com processos e procedimentos definidos.
  • Garantir a aplicação dos processos de governança de TI.
  • Comunicação direta com outros escritórios regionais.
  • Manutenção em Data Center.

Experiência Técnica:

  • Windows Server (desejável/diferencial ter Certificação).
  • Linux Server (RedHat).
  • Vivência com projetos de infraestrutura.
  • Básico de Telecom (Switches, Roteadores, Vlan, Link de Dados) - Telecom (manutenção de terminais IPC e testes de gravações Verint).
  • DFS.
  • Citrix e Virtualização (Hyper-V / Vmware).
  • Ferramentas de backup: NetBackup.
  • Ferramentas de E.mail e ferramentas de monitoramento como: SCOM, HPOpenView for Linux, Fluke NetFlow, Cacti e NNMi.
  • SCCM.
  • Administração de Storage / servidores Blades.
  • Noções de Cloud.
  • DESEJÁVEL certificação ITIL V3.

Formação Acadêmica:

  • Superior Completo em TI.
  • (Desejável) especialização na área.

Idioma:

  • Imprescindível INGLÊS nível AVANÇADO/ FLUENTE (para a conversação).

Atuação:

  • Híbrida (sendo 1x no escritório), entretanto é imprescindível ter flexibilidade para eventuais idas ao Data Center (Alphaville e Jundiaí).
  • Ter disponibilidade de horário.

title: Coordenador P & D (Embalagens)
description:
• Responsável pelo desenvolvimento de embalagens relacionados a categorias de café - torrado e moído, grãos torrados, solúveis (incluindo pó, aglomerado, freeze dried), descafeinados, chás e misturas para preparo de bebidas.
  • Responsável pela definição e critérios de especificação dos materiais de embalagens para projetos de inovação, otimização, manutenção e renovação de portfólio. Para execução de projetos, obedecer aos processos e fluxos de aprovação correspondentes.
  • Atuar junto às áreas de Operações em projetos de instalações de equipamentos, aumentos de capacidade, otimização de processos contribuindo com conhecimento técnico e analítico para tomada de decisão de negócio.
  • Em conjunto com especialistas de desenvolvimento de produtos e de desenvolvimento de processos, avaliar soluções tecnológicas e funcionais para entrega de um produto viável.
  • Responsável pela aplicação de conhecimentos e iniciativas em ciência e tecnologia e melhores práticas em alinhamento com as equipes globais, regionais e locais visando à redução de custos, de perdas, de impacto ambiental, de geração de resíduos e atendimento à requisitos globais e de legislação.
  • Responsável pelo desenho e definição de protocolos, planejamento, execução e reporte de testes industriais, comissionamentos e start-ups para o desenvolvimento de produtos atendendo aos requisitos do projeto e à melhor combinação de recursos disponíveis – tecnologia instalada, restrições correspondentes e oportunidades de melhorias.
  • Apoiar iniciativas de Qualidade em relação a metodologias de análises e critérios para liberação de produto, considerando análises de risco de qualidade, segurança do consumidor e experiência do cliente.
  • Responsável por transferir conhecimento técnico contribuindo para o desenvolvimento de equipes de produção, qualidade, marketing, atendimento ao consumidor e potenciais clientes / parceiros, através da elaboração de material técnico para treinamento, assim como procedimentos e instrução de trabalho que facilitem / orientem para execução das atividades.
  • Contribuir de forma estratégica para estudos de avaliação de consumidor e de concorrência, acompanhando tendências de mercado, oportunidades e correções.
  • Responsável pela coordenação de equipe, garantindo o desenvolvimento de atividades e atingimento de objetivos do negócio ao promover o crescimento individual e coletivo, tanto em aspectos técnicos como comportamentais. Contribuir para gestão de orçamento do departamento.
  • Obedecer aos procedimentos e políticas internas e contribuir positivamente para o clima organizacional e objetivos do negócio com respeito à aspectos de qualidade, segurança, meio ambiente e sustentabilidade, diversidade & inclusão e custos.

Qualificações

  • Superior completo em Engenharias (Alimentos, Química, Processos Industriais, Materiais, etc), Ciências de Alimentos, Química, Biologia e áreas correlatas.
  • Inglês em nível intermediário/avançado.
  • Experiência em indústrias de bens de consumo, preferencialmente alimentícia, em áreas de desenvolvimento de embalagens, qualidade e engenharia.
  • Desejável experiência anterior em projetos de melhoria e conhecimento com aplicativos de design como Adobe Ilustrador e SAP.
  • Disponibilidade para viagens e atuação em diferentes fábricas / localidades conforme a necessidade do negócio.

No Brasil, somos a segunda maior empresa de café e temos atuação nacional com liderança absoluta em São Paulo e no Rio de Janeiro, conhecida através de suas marcas Pilão, L’OR, Café do Ponto, Caboclo, Damasco e Café Pelé.

Como é trabalhar na JDE Peet's?

Somos pessoas unidas pelas possibilidades de chá e café. Na JDE Peet's, nós nos desenvolvemos com a liberdade de buscar oportunidades e de provocar novas ideias para causar grande impacto.

Nossa ambição é simples: despertar possibilidades de café e chá.
Colocamos em prática nossas intenções, cumprindo o que foi acordado e sempre levando as coisas adiante. Oferecemos aos nossos associados uma série de programas de aprendizado e desenvolvimento para apoiar seu crescimento pessoal.

Na JDE Peet's, acreditamos que é incrível o que acontece ao redor uma xícara de café ou chá.

Inscreva-se para experimentar uma xícara incrível em sua carreira.

title: Arquitecto de Soluciones (Solutions Architect II)
description:
Futurex está buscando personas con talento, con pasión por la tecnología e interés por los negocios, para unirse a nuestro equipo de Arquitectos de Soluciones en el puesto de Arquitecto de Soluciones.

El rol de Arquitecto de Soluciones es un híbrido entre el desarrollo de negocios y el soporte de TI. Los arquitectos de soluciones se sienten tan cómodos trabajando con la tecnología como con las personas. El puesto se centra inicialmente en el desarrollo de un profundo conocimiento de la tecnología de Futurex, participando en nuestro proceso de garantía de calidad del software, progresando en la asistencia al cliente y las ventas con organizaciones de nivel 1 en todo el mundo. Las responsabilidades incluyen:

  • Analizar los requisitos de los clientes y recomendar mejoras para nuestras soluciones criptográficas de vanguardia basadas en hardware.
  • Proporcionar apoyo técnico y orientación continuos a la base de clientes global de Futurex.
  • Solucionar problemas de hardware, software y firmware nuevos y existentes desarrollados para la industria de la seguridad y el cifrado de datos.
  • Impartir formación a los clientes sobre nuestros productos y las mejores prácticas de seguridad de datos.
  • Proporcionar servicios de gestión de proyectos para iniciativas de desarrollo personalizadas e implementaciones globales de plataformas de seguridad empresarial reforzadas.
  • Redactar y mantener la documentación técnica que se hace pública.
  • Comprender las API y los protocolos específicos del sector que se utilizan cuando se interactúa con sistemas externos.
  • Aplicar los conocimientos empresariales y la capacidad técnica para crear soluciones de vanguardia que ayuden a las empresas a proteger sus datos sensibles.

Requisitos

  • Licenciatura en una especialidad técnica y/o empresarial.
  • Amplia experiencia en tecnologías de la información.
  • Gran capacidad de resolución de problemas.
  • Gran capacidad de comunicación.
  • Mentalidad motivada y emprendedora.
  • Flexibilidad para ayudar en diferentes departamentos de la empresa.

Requisitos con mayor preferencia:

  • Familiaridad con la tecnología de cifrado de datos de la empresa, incluidos los módulos de seguridad de hardware (HSM); soluciones de gestión de claves, certificados y PKI de la empresa; y/o tokenización para el cumplimiento de PCI DSS.
  • 2-4 años de experiencia en un puesto relacionado con la ciberseguridad.
  • Experiencia en redes TCP/IP.
  • Experiencia con múltiples arquitecturas y plataformas.
  • Experiencia con Linux, OpenSSL, scripts (Python, Perl, Bash).
  • Experiencia en ventas y/o soporte técnico.

You can choose how your personal data is used. Vendors want your permission to do the following:

Store and/or access information on a device

Advertising presented to you on this service can be based on limited data, such as the website or app you are using, your non-precise location, your device type or which content you are (or have been) interacting with (for example, to limit the number of times an ad is presented to you).

Create profiles for personalised advertising

Information about your activity on this service (such as forms you submit, content you look at) can be stored and combined with other information about you (for example, information from your previous activity on this service and other websites or apps) or similar users. This is then used to build or improve a profile about you (that might include possible interests and personal aspects). Your profile can be used (also later) to present advertising that appears more relevant based on your possible interests by this and other entities.

Use profiles to select personalised advertising

Advertising presented to you on this service can be based on your advertising profiles, which can reflect your activity on this service or other websites or apps (like the forms you submit, content you look at), possible interests and personal aspects.

Information about your activity on this service (for instance, forms you submit, non-advertising content you look at) can be stored and combined with other information about you (such as your previous activity on this service or other websites or apps) or similar users. This is then used to build or improve a profile about you (which might for example include possible interests and personal aspects). Your profile can be used (also later) to present content that appears more relevant based on your possible interests, such as by adapting the order in which content is shown to you, so that it is even easier for you to find content that matches your interests.

Use profiles to select personalised content

Content presented to you on this service can be based on your content personalisation profiles, which can reflect your activity on this or other services (for instance, the forms you submit, content you look at), possible interests and personal aspects. This can for example be used to adapt the order in which content is shown to you, so that it is even easier for you to find (non-advertising) content that matches your interests.

Information regarding which advertising is presented to you and how you interact with it can be used to determine how well an advert has worked for you or other users and whether the goals of the advertising were reached. For instance, whether you saw an ad, whether you clicked on it, whether it led you to buy a product or visit a website, etc. This is very helpful to understand the relevance of advertising campaigns.

Measure content performance

Information regarding which content is presented to you and how you interact with it can be used to determine whether the (non-advertising) content e.g. reached its intended audience and matched your interests. For instance, whether you read an article, watch a video, listen to a podcast or look at a product description, how long you spent on this service and the web pages you visit etc. This is very helpful to understand the relevance of (non-advertising) content that is shown to you.

Understand audiences through statistics or combinations of data from different sources

Reports can be generated based on the combination of data sets (like user profiles, statistics, market research, analytics data) regarding your interactions and those of other users with advertising or (non-advertising) content to identify common characteristics (for instance, to determine which target audiences are more receptive to an ad campaign or to certain contents).

Develop and improve services

Information about your activity on this service, such as your interaction with ads or content, can be very helpful to improve products and services and to build new products and services based on user interactions, the type of audience, etc. This specific purpose does not include the development or improvement of user profiles and identifiers.

Use limited data to select content

Content presented to you on this service can be based on limited data, such as the website or app you are using, your non-precise location, your device type, or which content you are (or have been) interacting with (for example, to limit the number of times a video or an article is presented to you).

Ensure security, prevent and detect fraud, and fix errors

Your data can be used to monitor for and prevent unusual and possibly fraudulent activity (for example, regarding advertising, ad clicks by bots), and ensure systems and processes work properly and securely. It can also be used to correct any problems you, the publisher or the advertiser may encounter in the delivery of content and ads and in your interaction with them.

Deliver and present advertising and content

Certain information (like an IP address or device capabilities) is used to ensure the technical compatibility of the content or advertising, and to facilitate the transmission of the content or ad to your device.

Match and combine data from other data sources

Information about your activity on this service may be matched and combined with other information relating to you and originating from various sources (for instance your activity on a separate online service, your use of a loyalty card in-store, or your answers to a survey), in support of the purposes explained in this notice.

In support of the purposes explained in this notice, your device might be considered as likely linked to other devices that belong to you or your household (for instance because you are logged in to the same service on both your phone and your computer, or because you may use the same Internet connection on both devices).

Identify devices based on information transmitted automatically

With your acceptance, your precise location (within a radius of less than 500 metres) may be used in support of the purposes explained in this notice.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Sobre a Zippi

Fundada em 2019 por um grupo inquieto de empreendedores, a Zippi desde seu começo tem a missão simples e ambiciosa de ajudar quem trabalha por conta própria a prosperar.

Empreender não é fácil, em nenhuma escala, e quem está fazendo seu micro negócio hoje no Brasil tem a dificuldade adicional de que as ferramentas financeiras disponíveis não foram montadas pra eles.

O que a Zippi oferece hoje é um meio de pagamento feito pensando em quem é microempreendedor. Na hora de comprar insumos pro seu negócio, o nosso cliente não depende mais de ter grana no bolso, e não tem mais o risco de se enrolar como num cartão de crédito normal. A nossa linha de crédito, utilizada através do PIX, vira rapidamente a maneira predileta dos nossos clientes fazerem o negócio deles girar.

A Zippi recebeu mais de US$20m de investimento ao longo de três rodadas de investimento, e conta com investidores incríveis como Y Combinator, Canary, Hummingbird Ventures, Soma Capital e Tiger, além de fundadores e operadores de empresas como Square, Gympass, GuiaBolso, Cobli, Volanty e BizCapital.

Escopo da posição:

  1. Você será responsável pela arquitetura geral de software de novos projetos e dos serviços que temos na Zippi;
  2. Você colaborará com as principais decisões técnicas e validará os projetos de engenharia com as áreas de negócio;
  3. Você será responsável pela produção do produto, implementação e escrita de testes, incluindo o desenvolvimento de APIs;
  4. Você estimará tarefas relacionadas à engenharia fazendo suposições sobre dependências e riscos, e planejará roadmaps, releases e sprints para os membros da equipe;

  6. Você será responsável por resolver proativamente problemas nos processos e propor melhorias;
  7. Você ajudará a resolver os problemas técnicos do produto, fazendo parceria com membros da equipe para resolvê-los;
  8. Você identificará ineficiências na forma atual de trabalhar da engenharia e proporá sistemas, ferramentas e/ou processos que os gerentes de engenharia precisam implementar para resolvê-las;
  9. Você atuará e colaborará para estabelecer uma forte cultura de engenharia, incluindo processos como revisão de código, programação em pares, revisões de arquitetura, metas de cobertura de testes automatizados, etc.

Você é a pessoa ideal se:

  2. Experiência em lidar com sistemas de grande escala;

title: Senior oder Managing Consultant Digitale Transformation (m/w/d) Schwerpunkt Payments
description:
Ort/Region: Hamburg, Köln, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt, München, HomeOffice, 70 - 120 T€

Im Auftrag einer der Marktführer im Zahlungsverkehr suchen wir im Rahmen der nachhaltigen Expansion für beliebige Wohnorte im Bundesgebiet Sie als

Senior oder Managing Consultant Digitale Transformation (m/w/d) Schwerpunkt Payments

Als einer der Top 100 familienfreundlichsten Arbeitgeber Deutschlands bietet man Ihnen sehr anspruchsvolle und innovative Projektaufgaben , die den digitalen Wandel bei Banken, Kreditkartenunternehmen und anderen Zahlungsverkehrsdienstleistern vorantreiben.

Dabei geht es z.B. darum, mobile Bezahlverfahren noch anwenderfreundlich zu machen und dabei immer die IT Security im Auge zu behalten oder Instant Payment (Bezahlung in Echtzeit) zu ermöglichen. Im Fokus stehen auch stets die regulatorischen Anforderungen gemäß PSD2 (Payment Services Directive oder deutsch ZaDiRL = Zahlungsdiensterichtlinie). Hochkomplexe Projektaufgaben entstehen darüber hinaus bspw. bei der Überprüfung der ganzen System-Architekturen bei Banken, die optimiert oder gar ersetzt werden müssen.

Ihre Rollen in den agilen Projekten richten sich individuell nach Ihren bisherigen Erfahrungen und können von der fachlichen Anforderungsanalyse, der Prozessoptimierung oder der IT-Implementierung bis zum verantwortlichen (Groß-)Projektleiter reichen. Darüber hinaus können Sie z.B. auch strategische Aufgaben wie die Weiterentwicklung des Beratungsportfolios (Innovationsmanagement) und die Kundenentwicklung (vertriebliche Aktivitäten, Verfassen von Fachartikeln) übernehmen. Selbstverständlich entwickelt man Sie auch gerne in die eine oder andere Richtung, denn Mitarbeiter(innen)-Entwicklung wird bei Ihrem zukünftigen Arbeitgeber großgeschrieben .

Minimum Anforderungen:

Geeignete Bewerber(innen) verfügen typischer Weise über ein Studium der Informatik, einer Wirtschaftswissenschaft oder einer Naturwissenschaft. Im Vordergrund stehen jedoch Ihre mehrjährigen Projekterfahrungen im Zahlungsverkehr , die Sie z.B. bei einer Unternehmensberatung, einer Bank oder einem Zahlungsverkehrsdienstleister gesammelt haben.

Unser Auftraggeber ist finanziell unabhängig und nicht am Kapitalmarkt notiert. Hier zählen (familiäre) Werte und strategisches Denken mehr als kurzfristige Gewinnmaximierung . In der Folge ist die Fluktuation extrem niedrig und die Kundenbindung sehr hoch . Man fordert und fördert Sie und gibt Ihnen einen höchstmöglichen Gestaltungsfreiraum.

Unser Auftraggeber unterhält Niederlassungen u.a. in Hamburg, Köln/Düsseldorf, Frankfurt und München . Da ein Großteil Ihrer Aktivitäten remote erledigt werden kann, ist kein bestimmter Standort erforderlich. Für entsprechende Anlässe sind Sie aber selbstverständlich beratungstypisch bereit, deutschlandweite Termine wahrzunehmen.

Wir schreiben diese anspruchsvolle Position mit einer relativ großen Gehaltsspanne von 70-120 T€ (Gesamtpaket) aus, die sich wie folgt erklärt:

  • 70-90 T€ sind für eine projekterfahrene Persönlichkeit , die „nur“ die fachlich/technologischen Anforderungen erfüllt und sich weiterentwickeln möchte, vorgesehen.
  • Für ein höheres Einstiegsgehalt erwarten wir darüber hinaus (erste) Akquiseerfahrungen incl. Angebotserstellung und Verhandlungsführung .
  • Für das Spitzengehalt (100-120 T€) erwarten wir außerdem belastbare Kundenbeziehungen in der Zahlungsverkehrsbranche , die Sie einbringen können.
  • …Und für einen seltenen Team-Case legt unser Auftraggeber gerne noch ein paar Scheine drauf.

Ihre Bewerbung schicken Sie bitte an unter Angabe des Stellentitels und der Quelle, wo Sie diese Ausschreibung entdeckt haben.

description:
Allana Buick & Bers is a multi-disciplinary architectural, engineering and construction firm seeking a Waterproofing Consultant to help us expand our service offerings in roofing and wall design engineering, as well as construction defect litigation support solutions at our Guam office.

Job Responsibilities

  1. Providing technical expertise in roofing, waterproofing, and building envelope systems for design and oversight of technical work
  2. Managing repair and re-construction projects for apartments, condominiums, commercial and government buildings
  3. Supporting litigation efforts through mediation, deposition, arbitration and trial with a focus on plaintiff support
  4. Utilizing your network of attorneys and insurance adjusters in the local area to develop new business opportunities and grow the firm's service offerings

Desired Skills and Experience

  1. Technical degree (Bachelor's or higher) in engineering, architecture, construction management or a closely related discipline
  2. Expertise in roofing, waterproofing and building envelope systems, with a PE or RA license preferred

Benefits

About Us

Allana Buick & Bers, Inc. is a multi-disciplinary Architectural Engineering, Construction Management, and Forensic Consulting firm with over 36 years of experience in making buildings perform better.

Our services make buildings perform better by making them longer lasting with lower operating costs and reducing construction risk.

Tremendous opportunities for growth, learning, and advancement exist for the right candidate. We are an equal-opportunity employer and encourage diversity.

title: SALES DIRECTOR - BRAZIL
description:
Our client is a Spanish SaaS company, ranked among the 10 most promising Startups in Spain and one of the most important in Europe, growing internationally across different continents.

It currently serves thousands of customers in over 60 countries and has built a talented team of over 200 people, with headquarters based in Barcelona.

ABOUT THE ROLE:

We are looking for a talented leader to launch and rapidly expand the team in Brazil. You will report to our Senior Sales Manager, who is seeking a right-hand person to replicate their successful market launch strategy in Brazil. You will act as a GM, taking on the responsibilities of securing an office, recruiting and hiring a team of SDRs and Account Executives, and working closely with the team to define our Go-to-market strategy.

If you are excited to build something from scratch, this role is an amazing opportunity for you.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:

  1. You will set the objectives for your team, create sales plans, analyze data, and contribute to the company's growth.
  2. You will be responsible for leading your team to reach sales targets, establish the strategy, and provide guidance, training, and mentorship to the sales team in Brazil.
  3. You will also be a culture leader in the office and drive engagement and connection across the team.

We currently have companies in Brazil reaching out to us for help with their People Management needs. We have a strong tech stack to facilitate sales and a great marketing team delivering content in the Brazilian market. What we really need now is you to build the team!

WORK EXPERIENCE / SKILLS REQUIREMENTS:

  1. You are a self-starter, independent leader with a passion for sales coaching.
  2. You have deep knowledge of sales processes and methodologies, and possess a strong skill set to share that knowledge with the team you are building.
  3. A history of taking on big challenges and finding success runs in your blood. Experience leading both inbound and outbound SDR models is a must.
  4. You have 7+ years of experience in sales, with 3 of those being in a sales manager role for a software as a service company.
  5. Languages: Portuguese (fluent), English (fluent), Spanish a plus but not required.
  6. Industry: Business management software for small and medium-sized companies (Human Resources Tech a plus).
  7. Experience in sales hiring processes, with a strong network of sales reps to join your team.
  8. Training process: Sales methodology knowledge to achieve fast sales ramp-up and revenue growth.
  9. Lead by example, with strong sales capabilities and a goal achiever.
  10. Upon hire, you are willing to spend several weeks at our Barcelona, Spain HQ to train and meet the team.

BENEFITS:

The company offers a competitive salary, a positive work environment, and career development opportunities.

title: Vice President of Institutional Advancement
description:
Why the American University of Iraq—Baghdad? Opening its doors in January 2021, the new American University of Iraq—Baghdad (AUIB) began as a dream of influential individuals in Iraqi and United States business, industry and government who want to see a world-class institution of higher learning established in the city, reminiscent of the days when Baghdad was an educational mecca and flourishing capital of the Muslim world. With a great library, palatial college buildings and student centers, state-of-the-art classrooms, laboratories, and athletic facilities, AUIB will be a beautiful campus, attracting students, faculty, and staff from throughout the world. We invite you to join us in this exciting new venture.

This position will report directly to the University President.

Position Summary

The Vice President of Institutional Advancement (VPIA) will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of the American University of Iraq-Baghdad by securing the necessary resources to support its mission. This position offers a unique opportunity to contribute significantly to the growth and development of a dynamic new educational institution in a culturally rich and diverse region.

Primary Responsibilities Include The Following

  1. Fundraising and Development: The VPIA will lead and manage all aspects of fundraising initiatives, focusing particularly on securing major gifts from individual, corporate, and foundational donors through a metrics-driven approach, as well as launching special events. This role entails the development and implementation of innovative and effective strategies for donor engagement and resource mobilization.
  2. Donor Relationship Management: A critical function of this position involves the cultivation and maintenance of robust relationships with a diverse range of donors. The VPIA will need to identify, engage, and nurture relationships with new and existing donors, ensuring a sustainable and growing base of support for the university. Additionally, the VPIA will develop and support alumni engagement strategies to maintain close relations with future alumni, which will include events and ambassador programs.
  3. Global Network Expansion: The role demands the possession of an extensive global network of prospective donors, with a special emphasis on the Middle East, North America, and Europe. VPIA should demonstrate an ability to leverage these networks effectively for the benefit of the university’s advancement goals. In particular, the VPIA should have knowledge of the Iraqi Diaspora and how to leverage it for fundraising.
  4. Strategic Leadership: As a key member of the university’s senior leadership team, the VPIA will contribute to strategic planning and decision-making processes. This includes working with the president, senior staff, deans, department heads, faculty, and other stakeholders to develop philanthropic priorities and goals to increase levels of support from donors and to align fundraising efforts with the university’s overall mission and objectives.
  5. Management: The VPIA will lead and grow a team of fundraising and advancement professionals utilizing inspiring transformational leadership and astute transactional leadership. The VPIA will oversee systems that ensure that prospects and donors are tracked, acknowledged, and stewarded in a strategic and timely manner.

Minimum Qualifications

  1. 10 or more years of experience in Advancement: candidates must present a history of successful work experience leading university advancement departments. This experience should include demonstrable achievements in significant fundraising campaigns and donor relationship management. Experience in working with Diaspora communities is desirable but not required.
  2. Bi-Regional Expertise: Applicants must possess experience working in both the Middle East and the United States in the field of advancement. This bi-regional expertise is critical for understanding the cultural nuances and fundraising dynamics specific to these regions. Knowledge of Arabic is advantageous, but not required.
  3. Proven Leadership Abilities: A track record of effective leadership in previous roles is essential, including serving as a strategic advancement partner to a president, provost, dean or other executive. Candidates should demonstrate experience in guiding teams towards achieving fundraising goals and in fostering a culture of philanthropy within an organization. Candidates should be able to cultivate strong and positive working relationships at every level.
  4. Educational Background: A minimum of a PhD or other earned doctorate degree in any field is required.
  5. Communication Skills: Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, are requisite for this role. The VPIA must articulate the university’s vision and goals compellingly to a diverse range of stakeholders.
  6. Ethical Standards and Integrity: Adherence to the highest ethical and professional standards and a commitment to integrity in all fundraising activities and donor interactions are paramount. Knowledge of and commitment to best practices in the field is essential.

Application Requirements for Positions at the American University of Iraq—Baghdad

Required

To be considered for any role at the American University of Iraq—Baghdad (AUIB), applicants are required to submit the following documents:

  1. Cover letter: This should detail how your skills and experience align with the specific requirements of the position you are applying for.
  2. Resume/Curriculum Vitae: Please provide an up-to-date resume or CV.
  3. Identification: A valid national ID or passport is required for the application process.
  4. Please note that applications missing any of these components will not be considered.

Shortlisted Candidates

If you are shortlisted for an interview, you will need to provide additional documentation:

  1. Educational transcripts and certifications must be translated into English.
  2. References: You must provide contact details for three references. These individuals should be those who have either worked with you or supervised your work.

We look forward to receiving your complete applications and appreciate your interest in joining our dynamic team at AUIB.

title: SENIOR SOFTWARE SECURITY ENGINEER
description:
Our client is a venture-backed fintech with a mission to give employees instant access to their earned wages, solving a major problem for real people while eliminating predatory financial products like payday loans. It is the fastest-growing startup in the category and was incubated by QED Capital, a top fintech venture fund.

The company’s app provides earned wage access for employees at mid- to large-sized organizations to improve their financial wellness and increase employee engagement and productivity. With many workers living paycheck to paycheck, financial wellness tools are an important part of any employee benefits package. The company gives employees access to the money they have already earned whenever they need it, without waiting for the month-end paycheck. The service is mobile app-based, very easy and intuitive to use, with a small transaction fee and no interest to pay—a healthier solution than payday loans or bank overdrafts.

The company’s ultimate mission is to help people attain financial freedom, starting with giving them full control over their income.

ABOUT THE ROLE:

We are looking for a Senior Software Security Engineer to work on our Security team. You will interact with multiple development squads to help us fix vulnerabilities, prevent incidents, and implement improvements and security controls in our systems. You must have knowledge of application security, secure development, and fraud detection.

The ideal candidate will embrace the team’s global culture, rooted in Shokunin—the Japanese philosophy of giving your very best for the general welfare of people. The company’s other core values are radical transparency and zero ego.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:

  1. Design and implement systems that enhance the security of API products and applications.
  2. Design and implement abuse detection systems.
  3. Conduct design and code reviews.
  4. Evaluate engineering responses to security threats and implement mitigations.
  5. Provide security guidance to new projects and initiatives.

WORK EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS:

  1. 5+ years of software development experience.
  2. 3+ years of industry experience developing and implementing security features and solutions.
  3. Experience advocating for technical security solutions across functional domains.
  4. Experience designing and deploying authorization systems.
  5. Experience with Fraud Detection, Application Security, and Secure Development.
  6. You are a team player—one of the most important responsibilities of a security team member is to interact with other teams.
  7. You have the curiosity to understand how systems work on every level.
  8. You have working experience with software development.
  9. You have working experience with distributed systems and microservices.
  10. You are proficient in English.

Note: Examples of past work will be required as part of the hiring process.

title: Pessoa Gerente de Monitoria e Treinamento - Osasco
description:
Pessoa Gerente de Monitoria e Treinamento - Osasco

Sobre o Bradesco

Pensamos em estratégias que sejam capazes de criar oportunidades para a realização das pessoas e para o desenvolvimento sustentável de empresas e sociedade. Ao longo de oito décadas, com pioneirismo e inovação, contribuímos com a democratização do acesso aos serviços bancários no Brasil e fomos além, nos tornamos um dos maiores grupos financeiros da América Latina.

Suas atividades com a gente envolvem:

  1. Desenvolvimento de conteúdo de treinamento: Criar materiais de treinamento eficazes que atendam às necessidades da equipe, incluindo manuais, apresentações, vídeos e atividades práticas;
  2. Definição de padrões de qualidade: Estabelecer critérios e padrões claros de qualidade para os produtos, serviços ou processos que serão monitorados;
  3. Condução de sessões de treinamento: Facilitar sessões de treinamento interativas para transmitir informações e habilidades aos funcionários, utilizando métodos como palestras, estudos de caso e simulações;
  4. Monitoramento de desempenho: Acompanhar regularmente o desempenho das equipes ou indivíduos em relação aos padrões de qualidade estabelecidos, utilizando métricas e indicadores relevantes;
  5. Análise de tendências: Analisar os dados de monitoria ao longo do tempo para identificar padrões, tendências e áreas de risco, e propor medidas corretivas ou melhorias contínuas;
  6. Relatórios e comunicação: Preparar relatórios detalhados sobre os resultados da monitoria de qualidade e comunicar as conclusões e recomendações relevantes às partes interessadas, como a equipe de gestão e os departamentos envolvidos.

Para essa oportunidade você precisa:

  1. Superior completo, desejável curso na área de Humanas.
  2. Conhecimento em MASP, PDCA ou 5S.
  3. Conhecimento de ferramentas como discadores e ferramentas digitais (SMS/Chatbot/Whatsapp/URA etc).
  4. Conhecimento em inglês.

Benefícios:

  1. Remuneração: Aderente às melhores práticas de mercado.
  2. PLR (Participação nos Lucros e Resultados): Aderente às melhores práticas de mercado.
  3. Saúde: Plano de saúde, odontológico e seguro de vida, além de descontos em farmácias.
  4. Auxílios: Refeição, alimentação e transporte.
  5. Previdência: Plano opcional e exclusivo para funcionários, com participação financeira da Organização Bradesco.
  6. Bem-estar: O programa interno Viva Bem Bradesco conta com diversas iniciativas para prevenção de doenças e promoção de hábitos, atitudes e comportamentos saudáveis, além de oferecer orientação e aconselhamento para resolução de problemas pessoais, familiares, legais e financeiros.
  7. Capacitação: Por meio da Universidade Corporativa Bradesco, a Unibrad, investimos no aprendizado pessoal e profissional do nosso time, promovendo soluções de aprendizagem e parcerias com instituições de ensino.
  8. Isenção de tarifas: Cesta de serviços bancários exclusiva, com descontos e condições especiais em diversos produtos e serviços da Organização Bradesco.

Do Brasil para o Mundo

  • Avaliar e documentar a eficácia da implantação, identificando oportunidades de melhoria contínua.

Requisitos e qualificações

  • Conhecimento avançado em planejamento financeiro e orçamento;

title: Director, Transfer Pricing
description:
In a world of disruption and increasingly complex business challenges, our professionals bring truth into focus with the Kroll Lens. Our sharp analytical skills, paired with the latest technology, allow us to give our clients clarity—not just answers—in all areas of business. We embrace diverse backgrounds and global perspectives, and we cultivate diversity by respecting, including, and valuing one another. As part of One team, One Kroll , you’ll contribute to a supportive and collaborative work environment that empowers you to excel. 

Our Transfer Pricing practice provides comprehensive transfer pricing advisory covering compliance, planning, controversy and implementation.

At Kroll, your work will help deliver clarity to our clients’ most complex governance, risk, and transparency challenges. Apply now to join One team, One Kroll . 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Develop, recommend, and deliver transfer pricing services in a timely manner:
  • Work with multi-national clients to identify and assess cross border inter-company transactions
  • Develop local country transfer pricing documentation
  • Strategize on local country revenue authority transfer pricing audits
  • Participate in advanced pricing agreements (APA)
  • Global transfer pricing planning:
  • Continuous work towards optimization of the client's existing and new foreign inter-company transactions
  • Special projects relating to client restructuring, acquisition or divestiture
  • Develop and maintain client relationships
  • Manage the work of client service team members and mentor staff
  • Prepare and analyze financial and economic data through the use of various software and statistical sampling packages
  • Prepare quality, practical approaches to the client's economic situation and arrive at logical business-based conclusions

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Bachelor's degree in Economics, Finance, Accounting or Statistics. MBA or Master’s degree preferred
  • Demonstrated understanding of complex transfer pricing concepts, including an in-depth knowledge of the international transfer pricing environment
  • Ability to effectively apply economic and financial knowledge to client business issues
  • 10+ years relevant transfer pricing advisory experience including documentation, research, planning, valuation of intangibles, APAs, and development and review of complex valuation models, preferably in a consulting environment
  • Knowledge of U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)
  • Exceptional analytical, research, and quantitative skills
  • Excellent project management and presentation skills, including superior verbal and written communication skills
  • Highly energetic and a self-starter with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced professional services environment 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills that help represent diverse communities
  • Experience working with diverse teams

In order to be considered for a position, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.com. 

Kroll is committed to equal opportunity and diversity, and recruits people based on merit.

title: Vice President of Research
description:
Why the American University of Iraq—Baghdad?
Opening its doors in January 2021, the new American University of Iraq—Baghdad (AUIB) began as a dream of influential individuals in Iraqi and United States business, industry and government who want to see a world-class institution of higher learning established in the city, reminiscent of the days when Baghdad was an educational mecca and flourishing capital of the Muslim world. With a great library, palatial college buildings and student centers, state-of-the-art classrooms, laboratories, and athletic facilities, AUIB will be a beautiful campus, attracting students, faculty, and staff from throughout the world. We invite you to join us in this exciting new venture.

This position will report directly to the University President

Job Title: Vice President of Research

Department: Office of Research

Job Summary: The Vice President of Research plays a critical leadership role in advancing the research agenda of AUIB. This position is responsible for providing strategic direction, oversight, and coordination of all research activities within the university. The Vice President of Research works closely with faculty, staff, and external partners to promote a culture of research excellence and innovation.

Key Responsibilities

Strategic Leadership:

  • Develop and implement a comprehensive research strategy aligned with the university’s mission and goals.
  • Identify emerging research trends and opportunities and guide the university’s research priorities accordingly.
  • Foster a culture of research excellence, integrity, and collaboration across all academic departments and disciplines.

Administration:

  • Oversee the Research Office and all university research operations.
  • Develop university research themes and foster new research initiatives.
  • Delegate regulatory responsibility to appropriate university units.
  • Oversee all research centers, institutes, and appropriate shared or core research facilities.
  • Oversee research partnerships with industry, government, and partner institutions.
  • Represent the university at appropriate research initiatives/collaborations and programs.
  • Represent the university on the appropriate national and international research committees.
  • Communicate and report on the state of the research enterprise.
  • Develop and ensure the maintenance of policies and procedures and fiscal responsibilities for the Research Office and all pre- and post-grant award activities.
  • Ensure university membership in the appropriate professional research associations.
  • Oversee the outstanding faculty and student research awards.

Research Funding And Grants:

  • Identify and pursue external funding opportunities, grants, and partnerships to support research activities.
  • Provide guidance and support to faculty in the preparation and submission of research grant proposals.
  • Oversee the administration of research grants, ensuring compliance with funding agency requirements.

Research Conduct:

Human Research Participants:

  • Ensure the University’s human research participant protection program.
  • Ensure stakeholders and affiliates have adequate resources and appropriate oversight.
  • Receive and assess reports of non-compliance.
  • Place limitations or conditions on an investigator’s or research staff’s privilege to conduct human research.
  • Ensure that University officials cannot approve human research not by one of the Institution’s IRBs.
  • Disallow research approved by the Institution’s IRB or an external IRB.
  • Execute the education and training of personnel in support of an ethical human research participants program.

Animal Subjects:

  • Execute a humane and ethical animal welfare program in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, policies and procedures.
  • Communicate non-compliance to appropriate regulatory bodies.
  • Execute the education and training of personnel in support of humane animal care and use.
  • Establish a university animal care and use committee.

Research Safety and Integrity:

  • Support compliance of all government environmental, health, and safety regulations.
  • Ensure the education and training of personnel in safe research practices.
  • Promote a culture of research integrity.
  • Ensure secure and ethical data use, data confidentiality, and compliant data management, sharing, ownership, and retention practices.
  • Promote compliance for responsible and ethical conduct of research professional development and training requirements.

Patents and Inventions:

  • Promote and support a culture of innovation and entrepreneurship.
  • Oversee policies and procedures on royalties and royalty sharing.
  • Oversee the office of IP.

Research Funding:

  • Ensure high quality and high volume of research applications.
  • Oversee the grant application priorities and submissions.
  • Engage with the government and industry to establish partnerships for sponsored research.

Faculty Support And Development:

  • Collaborate with academic departments to recruit, retain, and support research-active faculty.
  • Promote faculty development in research, including mentoring, training, and facilitating interdisciplinary collaborations.
  • Recognize and reward outstanding research achievements among faculty.
  • Research Infrastructure and Resources:
  • Ensure the availability of state-of-the-art research facilities, equipment, and resources for faculty and students.
  • Manage and allocate research space and resources efficiently.

Application Requirements for Positions at the American University of Iraq—Baghdad:

Required:

To be considered for any role at the American University of Iraq—Baghdad (AUIB), applicants are required to submit the following documents:

  • Cover letter: This should detail how your skills and experience align with the specific requirements of the position you are applying for.
  • Resume/Curriculum Vitae: Please provide an up-to-date resume or CV.
  • Identification: A valid national ID or passport is required for the application process.
  • Please note that applications missing any of these components will not be considered.

Shortlisted Candidates:

If you are shortlisted for an interview, you will need to provide additional documentation:

  • Educational transcripts and certifications must be translated into English.
  • References: You must provide contact details for three references. These individuals should be those who have either worked with you or supervised your work.

We look forward to receiving your complete applications and appreciate your interest in joining our dynamic team at AUIB.

title: Network Security Engineer
description:
Network Security Engineer

Apply locations BRA - Virtual - Brazil

Time Type: Full time

Posted on: Posted 7 Days Ago

Job Requisition ID: R2034

An extraordinarily talented group of individuals work together every day to drive TNS' success, from both professional and personal perspectives. Come join the excellence!

Overview

The Network Security Engineer is responsible for the configuration, monitoring, management, and troubleshooting of firewalls. They will act as liaison with local region network engineering and technical support groups to assist and lead (where applicable) in the reviewing, design and deployment of new services, review existing services and migration of services/systems. Day to day duties will be assigned by monitoring of the Remedy ticket queue. All work must be completed following TNS Security policies and payment industry standards as well as the promotion of security best practices, to allow TNS business to operate and communicate in a secure solution.

Responsibilities

Essential responsibilities include:

  • Function as an internal consulting resource on network security issues specifically firewall technologies, such as Next Generation Firewall (NGFW), Unified Threat Management (UTM): Cisco ASA, Fortinet and Juniper SRX.
  • Familiar with implementing firewall security policies.
  • Day to day responsibilities to include standard change control, troubleshooting issues, configuration, monitoring, and management of firewalls in conjunction with TNS Security/Network engineers and vendor-provided support.
  • Monitor ticket queue application for Firewall Operations trouble tickets for incidents and creation of change requests.
  • Perform recurring maintenance activities such as device upgrades and patches with primary focus on firewalls and on perimeter devices.
  • Be the lead technical resource on projects requiring firewall support including end of life hardware replacement, customer migrations, and buildout of new PoPs.
  • Participate in the Network Security on-call rota to ensure that out of hours incidents are responded to in a timely manner.
  • Produce technical process documentation for use within the department.
  • Provide training and knowledge sharing with the rest of the department where required.
  • Be the focal engineer with the Network Security team for the Financial Services Division (FSD).
  • Manage key relationships with security partners and other internal departments.
  • Govern certification, adherence, and compliance to all security requirements as required by TNS.
  • Understand and keep up to date with the latest security issues.
  • Sponsor and execute technology & security advancements.
  • Ensure production systems are secure, up to date and vulnerabilities managed in a timely and effective manner.
  • In-depth operational and technical knowledge of cybersecurity concepts including, but not limited to Security, Information, and Event Monitoring (SIEM) tools.
  • Work closely with the Director, Security Engineering and other team members on various projects in the Global IT Security department and escalate security issues to the relevant senior members.
  • IPS/IDS technologies; Signature and pattern-based intrusion detection and prevention systems: Sourcefire and Fortinet.
  • VPN Technologies; IPSEC client & L2L tunnel, SSL client and clientless connectivity.
  • Follow documented processes, procedures and policies and maintain documentation related to work area and routinely update architecture diagrams using Visio.
  • Some travel to client sites, conferences, and other events may be necessary.

Experience:

  • Experience in creating policies in and managing Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE).
  • Hands-on experience in computer routing and networking, especially with firewall technologies.
  • Hands-on experience with multi-context firewall implementation (Cisco, Fortigate and Juniper).
  • Must have networking TCP/IP routing protocol experience.
  • Experience analyzing and troubleshooting Access Control Lists (ACLs) and VPN tunnels on firewalls.
  • Experience with firewalls, remote access VPN implementation, troubleshooting, and problem resolution is desired.
  • Experience with Cisco ACS, ISE.
  • Security and networking certifications from organizations such as Cisco, Fortigate and/or Juniper.

Qualifications:

  • Appropriate Bachelor's level qualification or 5+ years of experience in relevant positions.

Benefits:

  • Health insurance
  • Dental plan
  • Life insurance
  • Meal/Food voucher
  • Gympass
  • Totalpass
  • LinkedIn Learning
  • EAP – Employee Assistance Program
  • Scout – Referral Program
  • Birthday Day Off
  • Career Mentoring
  • Connect with HR
  • Wedding gift

If you are passionate about technology, love personal growth and opportunity, come see what TNS is all about!

TNS is an equal opportunity employer. TNS evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.

About Us

With employees based in 21 countries around the world, TNS is a leading global provider of data communication and interoperability services to diverse industries, such as retail, banking, payment processing, telecommunications, and the financial markets.

TNS’ services extend to over 60 countries and we deliver mission-critical solutions to many Fortune 500 companies. TNS employees play a vital role in the delivery of our services and we recognize them as our most valuable asset. We are proud to offer competitive salaries and benefit packages, and due to the global nature of our business we can offer opportunities to relocate to different locations, if your personal circumstances change.

Please take the time to view the job openings on this website and submit an application. You are welcome to apply for multiple opportunities and our system is designed to keep you informed on your application status.
