title: Sales manager
description:
The world’s leading supplier of mineral-based specialty solutions for industry with 14,000 employees, operations in more than 40 countries, and €4.3 billion in revenue in 2022.

Imerys delivers high-value-added, functional solutions to a great number of sectors, from processing industries to consumer goods. The Group draws on its understanding of applications, technological knowledge and expertise in material science to deliver solutions by beneficiating its mineral resources, synthetic minerals and formulations. Imerys’ solutions contribute essential properties to customers’ products and their performance, including heat resistance, hardness, conductivity, opacity, durability, purity, lightness, filtration, absorption and water repellency. Imerys is determined to develop responsibly, in particular by fostering the emergence of environmentally-friendly products and processes.

If you want to grow your skills and develop your career, find out more at

The Position

Job Summary

Company

On March 28, 2024, Imerys Group ( published a press release announcing it has entered into exclusive negotiations with Flacks Group for the contemplated divestment of its assets producing kaolin, ground calcium carbonate (“GCC”), precipitated calcium carbonate (“PCC”), and talc, which primarily serve the paper markets in North Americas, South America, Asia and Europe.

The future company formed by all these industrial sites, kaolin mine, port and logistic hubs is foreseen to start its operation under a new brand in the course of 2024. It will offer mineral solutions for industries worldwide. Currently serving mostly the paper and board markets, the new company will use its global footprint, unique assets and longstanding know-how to develop new business opportunities and foster innovation. Sustainability is a core value of this company.

With an annual revenue of around 350 million euros in 2023, this activity will employ about 1000 employees. The Company needs to reinforce the existing teams to operate as a standalone organization but also to meet its ambitious development plans.

Role overview

Drive organic and inorganic growth for customers and prospects in the perimeter you are responsible for. Support business and market developments, working with Business Development, S&T and Marketing.

Be responsible for the profitability of the activity on all the customers present in your perimeter.

Missions

  1. Develop and Execute the commercial roadmaps developed for your segment/products/perimeter;
  2. Execution of price increase as per the pricing strategy;
  3. Account Management, scope includes (but not limited to): negotiating short term and long term contracts, identifying growth/profitability improvement opportunities and advancing relationships with customers in order to maximize our share in the addressable markets;
  4. Ensure business performance by servicing existing customer base (or exceeding) their expectations and developing new growth opportunities;
  5. Develop plans and strategies for developing new commercial opportunities and achieving the sales goals with a strong ability to build both internal and external relationships;
  6. Establishing and nurturing relationships with customers (multi-level management - upper management, purchasing, R&D);
  7. Analyses of sales trends and preparation of reports for management and advise on business;
  8. Participate in the building of the annual sales plan, budget, forecasts and mid-term plan for your perimeter;
  9. Ensure forecast accuracy and jointly manage customer relationship with Customer Service Team;
  10. Ensure the promotion of customer focus in the organization;
  11. Feed CRM with customer, market and competitor information.

Responsibilities

The commitment of the employee goes beyond respecting rules and procedures. Each employee is responsible to identify and report unsafe situations, in order to guarantee that corrective actions are implemented before an accident happens. The employees should develop ideas to improve safety and have an active role in its implementation.

The employee is responsible for her/his own safety and other members of the team. Safety is everybody's commitment. She/he should use the correct PPE; know and follow the norms/protocols/procedures of EHS. It is important that the employee is committed to sustainable actions, focusing on activities to lower our impact in the environment, acting with ethics, and respecting diversity and inclusion.

Knowledge and skills:

  • Strong leadership skills to find win-win solutions both internally and externally;
  • Strong time management skills necessary to balance rigorous field work schedule;
  • Strong technical skills to understand how our products add value to the customer;
  • Strong knowledge of the Paper & Board Market.

Typical profile:

  • Business acumen and technical appetite;
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills;
  • Energetic top performer who is ready to meet the requirements of a demanding customer base.

Qualification & Experience:

Degree in preferably Chemistry, or Chemical or Mechanical Engineering.

Experience: minimum 5 years experience in a commercial role with strong exposure to complex customers.

Fluent in English and Spanish.

Position Type

Full time and Permanent.

title: Brazil – Technology Development Specialist
description:
World Team Manaus’ vision is to cooperate with the local church in strengthening and multiplying indigenous churches and leaders in the city of Manaus and the surrounding region with the aim of encouraging, mentoring, training, and equipping indigenous church planters to serve in the greater Amazon region.

The Technology Development Specialist will strive to see the gospel established in unengaged and unreached communities in the urban center of Manaus and the surrounding region by providing technical support, education, and tools to the ministry team, indigenous church leaders, and indigenous communities.

The ideal candidate will have a mature walk with the Lord where they continually seek to grow in godliness, abide in Christ, and evangelize and make disciples within their current context. Ideal character traits for this candidate include flexibility, humility, patience, resiliency, interest in other cultures and peoples, and a genuine love for the lost.

The ministry context involves working with populations (or communities) who have a history and current context of discrimination, marginalization, trauma, and extreme poverty, as well as pervasive spiritual warfare. Wisdom and spiritual maturity are vitally important to navigate these challenges.

World Team highly values immersion into the local culture and context. Thus, the ideal candidate must be willing to work hard to learn the local language, worldviews, majority culture, and minority subcultures.

Qualifications

  • The ability to work on teams, be flexible and be a good team player
  • Creativity and ability to “think outside the box”
  • A heart for and desire to work with marginalized people groups
  • The ability to apply and adapt technological practices to new contexts
  • Biblical competency and theological training (formal or informal) with an ability to interpret and communicate Scripture
  • A willingness to learn new methods and an ability to adapt methods to different cultural contexts, with the purpose of equipping locals to do the same
  • An aptitude to discern between cultural norms and Biblical truths and to address problematic theology in a culturally informed manner
  • Experience in developing user-friendly applications and websites
  • An interest in developing applications/websites for use in evangelism, discipleship, and training
  • An ability or desire to learn how to teach technological content and social media to teammates, local church leaders, and communities
  • Knowledge regarding computer and internet security and tech support
  • Some experience in social media and graphic design
  • An ability to develop and adjust content for oral cultures and low-literacy populations
  • An ability to suspend judgment and work in high levels of ambiguity
  • A strong knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
  • A willingness to learn a level of Portuguese appropriate to their term and responsibilities

Responsibilities

The Technology Development Specialist will work on a team to provide mutual encouragement and accountability. They will:

  • Establish local relationships, share the gospel in culturally contextualized ways, and make disciples that make disciples
  • Identify disciples and connect them to other believers and a local church when possible (facilitating or creating opportunities as needed)
  • Promote maturity and healthy Christian living
  • Facilitate the training and equipping of local indigenous church leaders regarding the use of technological tools and supports
  • Provide technological support and training to teammates
  • Take part in field-level activities, including field retreats and conferences, regular business and prayer meetings, and other tasks as needed
  • Fulfill administrative requirements as a World Team missionary (may include reporting, bookkeeping, continuing education, professional development, etc.)
  • Develop interactive technological content and applications for the use of evangelism and discipleship among the indigenous (as skills apply)
  • Assist in team social media and graphic design (as skills apply)
  • Research changing trends regarding technology and its implications for church planting, rural Amazonia, and missions (as skills apply)
  • Build partnerships with local, national, and international churches and organizations already using tech in ministry in order to share resources (as skills apply)

Tipo de localização: Office Location / Office-based

DESCRIÇÃO:

Todos os dias, a ANDRITZ continua a fornecer soluções inovadoras de sucesso para nossos clientes globalmente. Por que temos tanto sucesso? Porque somos apaixonados e amamos o que fazemos! Estamos na vanguarda das tecnologias de engenharia do futuro, com soluções que garantem o sucesso de nossos clientes em setores-chave que estão moldando o futuro do mundo em que vivemos.

PRINCIPAIS RESPONSABILIDADES:

  1. Definir critérios de projeto e normas aplicadas na elaboração do projeto básico conceitual da usina e serviços auxiliares aplicado aos diagramas unifilares, fluxogramas, memorial descritivo e arranjo geral;
  2. Definir os padrões, coordenar e participar da elaboração da documentação executiva e detalhada do projeto, incluindo memoriais de cálculo, folha de dados, diagramas de interligação, plano de rotas e encaminhamentos, listas de materiais e outros documentos que sejam necessários ao projeto executivo dos sistemas auxiliares elétricos;
  3. Ser responsável pela coordenação geral e integração entre as engenharias nos projetos de UHE, monitorando e controlando a integração entre as diversas disciplinas de engenharia envolvidas no projeto;
  4. Coordenar e verificar a elaboração dos diagramas funcionais e desenhos construtivos dos painéis do projeto executivo para que o fabricante dos equipamentos possa realizar a montagem conforme o projeto aprovado;
  5. Coordenar e verificar os estudos de sistemas elétricos, tais como cálculos de curto-circuito, seletividade, luminotécnico, SPDA, coordenação de isolamento etc.;
  6. Elaborar a especificação técnica comum a todos os componentes de um projeto com fim de garantir a correta integração entre os sistemas;
  7. Planejar e controlar a emissão de documentação técnica de equipamentos, sistemas e serviços, bem como o envio dos documentos para a aprovação, garantindo o efetivo controle das datas de entrega e o índice de entrega de documento no prazo (OTD), incluindo a precedência de documentos entre engenharias;
  8. Realizar o planejamento das atividades (cronograma), monitorar e controlar o avanço das atividades de projeto, garantindo o cumprimento dos marcos de entrega;
  9. Elaborar o planejamento de atividades avaliando o esforço envolvido (horas), monitorando o avanço físico frente ao consumo de recursos (horas);
  10. Avaliar, interpretar e levantar os pontos críticos e as divergências entre a especificação técnica e a proposta técnica para a elaboração do projeto executivo da UHE;
  11. Promover iniciativas para garantir a qualidade dos documentos de projeto elaborados pela Andritz e seus subfornecedores, prezando pelo atendimento dos padrões de qualidade exigidos internamente e pelos clientes;
  12. Cumprir normas, instruções e procedimentos internos estabelecidos (qualidade, segurança do trabalho, segurança ambiental, meio ambiente, medicina preventiva e outras), visando adoção de ações preventivas para a garantia de boas condições ambientais e de trabalho na empresa.

FORMAÇÃO:

SKILLS TÉCNICAS:

  • NR10, NR12 e SEP;
  • Inglês – avançado;
  • Espanhol avançado – desejável.

title: Lead Account Manager – Iraq
description:
Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs

Lead Account Manager – Iraq

The Sales Account Manager is responsible for managing and growing fast-growing accounts within the UOP LST organization. The LST business is expected to grow (>30%) as a result of economic recovery from COVID as well as gain SOD from the competition. The LST Sales Account Manager will be responsible for managing aspects of engagements with existing and new customers, building relationships and understanding customer business to ensure LST meets its AOP targets. The Account Manager will define sales and growth strategy to retain key customers while improving win rates on competitive bids. Lastly, the Account Manager will identify opportunities and build additional growth through Multi-year Agreements, Enhanced Service, and Connected Offerings.

This exciting position is within the LST business within UOP. The selected candidate will be primarily responsible for growing Honeywell’s catalyst and adsorbent sales to customers within Iraq. The Sales Account Manager will be responsible for managing aspects of engagements with existing and NEW customers in Refining, Petrochemicals, and Gas Processing facilities within Iraq.

The successful candidate will generate sales leads, follow up on sales leads, present the top-level technical aspects of the products to customers, and drive deal closure. This person serves as the Champion for the Customer within Honeywell, driving to identify customer needs and match to Honeywell product leading to near-term and long-term revenue growth.

Key Responsibilities

Business Leadership:

  • Develop and drive customer growth strategies.
  • Deliver agreed annual sales revenue, direct margins, volumes, price, and product mix for UOP HSP product portfolio.
  • Manage the 18-month forecast in SFDC, work with Credit & Collections to maintain past dues in line with company’s working capital targets.
  • Responsible for long-term objectives such as year-over-year growth, profitability, and win rate, as well as near-term forecast accuracy for short-range-outlook (SRO), demand planning, and all financial forecasts.
  • Contribute to establishing a culture of ownership and accountability.
  • Create and manage account plans which roll up into a regional strategy for the Middle East.
  • Ensure up-to-date knowledge of UOP’s products and offerings in order to identify project opportunities.
  • Lead the project/opportunity development and commercial follow-through.

Business Growth:

  • Work closely with Honeywell Sales, Technical Sales, Business, Engineering, and Government relations personnel to create and execute growth plans as it relates to your assigned customer base.
  • Act as the decision point in support of marketing, selling, pricing, contracting, and execution of new business relative to the customer and program.
  • Drive new business proposals through cross-functional teams, working with the assigned personnel in proposal development and gaining required concurrence/approvals to pricing, technical plans, and other requirements as laid out in Honeywell instruction.

Critical Success Factors:

  • Knowledge of fundamental program and business management practices, ability to work effectively with ISC, Engineering, Sales, Finance, Pricing, Contract, and Customer & Product Support to achieve successful outcomes. Working knowledge of business and financial fundamentals (Profit & Loss, Investment Analysis, Balance Sheet, Green Sheets).
  • Strong presentation and communication skills.
  • Ability to make sound decisions and take quick actions to execute.
  • Preferred previous experience in/with this customer base.

You Must Have:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering.

- Experience in consulting sales of software in SaaS/Cloud

title: Product Designer - Remote - Latin America
description:
FullStack is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, and Stanford University build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential.

We’re most proud of:

  1. Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas.
  2. Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world’s greatest companies.
  3. Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users.
  4. Our 4.5-star rating on GlassDoor.
  5. Our client Net Promoter Score of 68, twice the industry average.
The Position:

We're looking to hire a Product Designer to join our team. You'll work with our incredible clients in one of two ways:

  • Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis.
  • Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack product team to build and deliver a product to our clients.
What We're Looking For:
  • +5 years of professional Product Design experience.
  • Advanced English is required.
  • Professional experience building SaaS applications (B2B or B2C).
  • Experience designing features for AI focused products (such as features that allow for personalization, prediction, automation, or conversation) is a plus.
  • You know your way around modern design software and are proficient with Figma, AdobeXD, or Sketch (We prefer Figma).
  • Be attentive to design details relating to styling, interactions, and design systems.
  • Can manage projects autonomously and serve as a design expert on the team.
  • You can communicate your decision-making process and present your designs internally and to clients.
  • Have a foundational understanding of HTML and CSS.
  • Experience working on Agile/Scrum teams.
  • Successful completion of a four-year college degree is required.
  • Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon.
  • Ability to identify with the goals of FullStack's clients, and dedicate yourself to delivering on the commitments you and your team make to them.
  • Ability to consistently work 40 hours per week.
What We Offer:
  • Competitive pay in your local currency.
  • 100% remote work.
  • The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies.
  • English Classes.
  • Virtual company events each month.
  • Ample opportunity for career advancement.
  • Continuing education opportunities.
  • Depending on your location other benefits may apply.

title: Sales Manager, Latin America Market
description:
Fapon Biotech is a subsidiary of Fapon Group, a global leader in in vitro diagnostic (IVD) products and services. Fapon Biotech is committed to providing diagnostic companies with high-performance IVD reagent raw materials, reagent services, and innovative open analyzers and instruments. The company focuses on future needs and emerging trends in IVD.

We are seeking a dynamic Sales Manager (Individual contributor) to join our team and contribute to our expansion and penetration into the IVD market of Latin America. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the market of Latin America and will develop the plan needed to reach the annual sales target apart from coordinating the sales team. Additionally, you will be conducting market due diligence and bringing new projects from the IVD customers, thereby improving Fapon’s visibility and reputation in the IVD market of Latin America.

Responsibilities

  • Develop the plan and execute sales strategies to achieve the annual sales target for the market of Latin America.
  • Conduct market due diligence and bring new projects from top IVD customers, thereby improving Fapon’s visibility and reputation in the IVD market of Latin America.
  • Analyze market trends and perform competitive landscape analysis for Fapon’s products.
  • Establish and maintain good relationships with industry KOLs/experts/decision-makers in healthcare, research, and academic settings.
  • Maintain awareness of the IVD industry and its trends in the Latin America market.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree and above in Life Sciences, with at least 3 years of sales experience in IVD raw materials/reagents or instruments, and familiarity with local IVD manufacturers.
  • Experience in direct sales networks with excellent cooperative relationships with local IVD manufacturers, familiar with the enterprise R&D decision-making process, or familiarity with key decision-makers is preferred.
  • English-speaking, willing to adapt to and grow in a culturally diverse and multinational IVD company.
  • Proactive attitude and positive approach.
  • Prior experience in the IVD industry pertaining to the sales of immunodiagnostic raw materials (antigens and antibodies) and reagents, automated chemiluminescence immunoassay (CLIA) analyzers, CLIA kits, immunoassays, ELISA, lateral flow immunoassays, and immunoturbidimetric assays.
  • Experience in open instruments, bulk reagents, molecular diagnostics, and NGS would be a plus.

Additional Information

At Fapon, we assure you of a great career and a very conducive work environment. We offer:

  • Financial security – good compensation and incentives.
  • We will continue to improve benefits & wellness programs as we grow.
  • Stable company with a great track record of continued strong financial performance over the years.

title: Coordinador/a programas Palestina
description:
Entidad que oferta: Alianza por la Solidaridad

Las candidaturas deberán presentarse por email a: y a , indicando la referencia "Coordinación Programas Palestina" en el asunto del email.
Se incluirá el CV y una carta de motivación, así como expectativa salarial.
La fecha límite para presentación de candidaturas es el 11 de junio de 2024.

Descripción de la oferta

Resumen del puesto de coordinador

El/la Coordinador/a de Programas de Alianza en Palestina liderará y gestionará el equipo de programas y la movilización de recursos para lograr las aspiraciones de la organización en Palestina, de acuerdo con su Estrategia País.

Será responsable de la supervisión global de la implementación de todas las intervenciones de la organización en Palestina, asegurando una adecuada gestión del ciclo del proyecto, desde la identificación y el diseño de intervenciones, la gestión de los contratos con los donantes, hasta la adecuada justificación de las intervenciones y rendición de cuentas a los financiadores.

Garantizará que se trabaja con organizaciones socias, aliadas y otros actores locales, promoviendo la agenda de localización y fomentando la relación a largo plazo.

Desempeñará un rol clave en el apoyo a la Coordinadora País en la representación externa e interna, y contribuirá a la visión estratégica y gestión del conocimiento en el país.

Funciones Principales

Estrategia y Operaciones

  1. Garantizar la correcta puesta en marcha y ejecución de las acciones que forman parte de la estrategia de Alianza en Palestina.
  2. Asegurar que todas las actividades que se lleven a cabo en Palestina sean sensibles al contexto y respondan a los cambios en los entornos político, social y económico.
  3. Asegurar un adecuado sistema de seguimiento técnico y financiero de las acciones, que permita identificar y establecer mecanismos de mitigación ante posibles desviaciones respecto a los resultados establecidos.
  4. Proporcionar la supervisión oportuna y eficaz de la situación financiera y administrativa de todos los proyectos, garantizando el cumplimiento tanto de normativa de las agencias financiadoras como de las autoridades locales y de la propia organización.
  5. Elaborar una adecuada planificación operativa de las intervenciones, que asegure la oportuna elaboración de informes a los financiadores y el cumplimiento de las metas de Alianza en el país.
  6. Representación de la organización ante socias locales, donantes, organizaciones palestinas e internacionales, instituciones públicas y redes y grupos de trabajo en el país, bajo las directrices de la Coordinación País.

Búsqueda de Financiación

  1. Contribuir a asegurar la diversificación de la financiación del trabajo de Alianza.
  2. Supervisar y/o liderar, según proceda, la formulación de propuestas de las intervenciones de cooperación al desarrollo, acción humanitaria, campañas de incidencia, gestión del conocimiento y comunicación.

Gestión de Personas

  1. Garantizar un entorno de trabajo propicio para el desarrollo del personal a su cargo.
  2. Participar en la revisión de las descripciones de puestos del personal bajo su responsabilidad y establecer objetivos y estándares de desempeño.
  3. Se involucrará en la contratación de personal bajo su responsabilidad y si es requerido, para otros departamentos.
  4. Proporcionar inducción, capacitación, entrenamiento, mentoría, retroalimentación y asesoramiento a las personas a su cargo.

Comunicación y Campañas

  1. Contribuir a preparar y sistematizar información para la página web, relacionada con los proyectos, temas y actividades bajo su responsabilidad.
  2. Colaborar con el área de comunicación en la estrategia de comunicación, aportando a los contenidos de campañas y actividades de difusión frente a medios y redes.
  3. Asegurar la información y comunicación adecuada con y sobre los donantes según lo requieran los diversos mecanismos y normativas de los mismos.

Integración en la Federación AAI y fusión con AAPalestina.

  1. Participar en los procesos de trabajo colectivos de la federación.
  2. Contribuir a la fusión e integración de Alianza en la federación ActionAid.
  3. Mantener informada a la sede en tiempo y forma de la situación de los proyectos.
  4. Asegurar un flujo regular de información disponible con otros departamentos y secciones de la organización.

Implementación de Políticas Internas

  1. Asegurar la aplicación del protocolo de seguridad bajo las instrucciones de la organización.
  2. Aplicar y respetar las políticas internas de la organización, con especial importancia el PSEA.
  3. Adoptar y promover los principios de Liderazgo Feminista de la organización.

Lugar de trabajo
La persona seleccionada como coordinador/a ejercerá sus funciones en Jerusalén Este.
La persona seleccionada deberá realizar cuantos traslados temporales y viajes sean necesarios, dentro de Palestina, para el correcto desempeño de sus funciones y cometidos.
Podrán darse viajes internacionales por motivos de trabajo.

Condiciones del puesto de coordinador
Salario: Según baremo interno de la organización, puesto Coordinación de Programas.
Fecha de inicio: Inmediata.
Ubicación: Jerusalén, con disponibilidad para viajes.

  • Licenciatura universitaria. Máster en Cooperación Internacional y/o Ayuda Humanitaria.
  • Mínimo 6 años de experiencia en cooperación internacional, de los cuales al menos 4 desempeñados sobre el terreno y en puestos similares.
  • Experiencia comprobada en puestos de coordinación, identificación, negociación y gestión de proyectos de desarrollo y de acción humanitaria.
  • Los idiomas de trabajo son el español y el inglés (ambos obligatorios).
  • Se valorará conocimiento del árabe.
  • Se requiere experiencia en metodologías de planificación, seguimiento y evaluación de proyectos.
  • Formación y experiencia de trabajo en acción humanitaria, derechos humanos y derechos de las mujeres.
  • Habilidades para la mediación y gestión de conflictos.
  • Habilidades de comunicación, negociación, empatía, diplomacia.
  • Se valorará conocimiento y experiencia en Palestina o en la región de Oriente Próximo, así como experiencia con donantes españoles, europeos e internacionales.
  • Se valorará experiencia en contextos de crisis y conflictos.

title: Customer Service Team Leader
description:
Selecione a frequência (em dias) de recebimento de alertas: Criar alerta

A Orbia tem uma equipe global de mais de 24.000 funcionários, atividades comerciais em mais de 100 países e operações em mais de 50, com sedes em Boston, Cidade do México, Amsterdã e Tel Aviv. A empresa gerou US$ 8,2 bilhões em receita em 2023.

A Orbia Building & Infrastructure faz parte da Orbia – uma empresa movida por um propósito comum: Melhorar a vida ao redor do mundo. A Orbia atua em diversos setores, incluindo: Soluções em Polímeros (Vestolit e Alphagary), Construção e Infraestrutura (Wavin), Agricultura de Precisão (Netafim), Soluções de Conectividade (Dura-Line) e Fluor and Energy Materials (Koura). Esses cinco grupos empresariais da Orbia têm um foco coletivo em expandir o acesso à saúde e bem-estar, reinventar o futuro das cidades e dos lares, garantir a segurança alimentar e hídrica, conectar as comunidades à informação e acelerar uma economia circular com materiais básicos e avançados, produtos especiais e soluções inovadoras.

A Orbia B&I tem 11.000+ funcionários e 65 locais de produção em todo o mundo, atendendo mais de 80 países por meio de uma rede global de vendas e distribuição. Nossas principais marcas comerciais são: Wavin, Amanco Wavin, Pavco Wavin, Plastigama Wavin e Bow Wavi.

Você é movido por propósitos? Tem mentalidade de crescimento? Está pronto para ampliar seu potencial? Então, bem-vindo ao negócio de Construção e Infraestrutura da Orbia, B&I onde nosso propósito de "melhorar a vida ao redor do mundo" impulsiona toda a nossa equipe global. Todos os dias, estamos pensando grande e trabalhando de forma inteligente para resolver alguns dos desafios mais difíceis que impactam o mundo, seja facilitando a água potável para as comunidades, criando cidades resilientes ao clima ou projetando espaços de vida mais confortáveis, nunca nos contentamos com o "bom o suficiente" quando há uma oportunidade de tornar a vida melhor. Onde o propósito ganha vida, ele muda vidas. É para isso que trabalhamos. E quanto a você?

Na Orbia Building & Infrastructure (Amanco Wavin), promovemos a vida em todo o mundo construindo ambientes saudáveis e sustentáveis. E onde é que a nossa ajuda é mais necessária? Os lugares em que vivemos: cidades onde a água potável está vazando, o verde está desaparecendo, as ruas estão inundando após fortes chuvas e sistemas de esgoto desatualizados estão poluindo nossas águas subterrâneas. É hora de fazer parte do nosso time e ajudar a construir ambientes mais sustentáveis!

Estamos atualmente procurando um Coordenador de Inteligência de Negócios e Desenvolvimento de vendas para se juntar a nós em Escritório São Paulo ou Fabrica Sumaré, Brasil. Se você quer fazer a diferença e trabalhar para uma empresa com propósito, verifique os requisitos necessários.

Como Coordenador de Inteligência de Negócios e Desenvolvimento de vendas você vai:

Ficará responsável pela gestão de equipe de analistas de vendas e time de vendas internas, com o objetivo melhorar a inteligência de negócios, desenvolvimento de vendas e produtividade do time comercial, através de criação e análise de dados, melhoria e automação de processos comerciais e gestão de projetos. Suporte a equipe de vendas das regionais em temas gerais.

Principais desafios da função:

  • Coordenação da área de Inteligência de Mercado, apoio em benchmark, processos de mapeamento, segmentação e estudo de mercado e concorrência;
  • Coordenar suas analistas para identificar e avaliar melhorias e conduzir os projetos para implementação, possibilitando uma melhor experiência aos vendedores e clientes buscando novas soluções em relação aos processos da organização garantindo uma visão de solução fim a fim nas operações de vendas;
  • Atuar nos Indicadores de Vendas, Ferramentas e Plataforma digital, Plano de Vendas, Comunicação da área comercial e temas ligados ao dia a dia do vendedor, participando ativamente na criação do novo Ritual de Vendas;
  • Responsável por análises de performance e criação de KPIs que identifiquem oportunidades comerciais/pontos de melhoria do time comercial;
  • Desenvolver e sustentar projetos com foco na área comercial, visando aumentar a produtividade e assertividade comercial em suas ações;
  • Interlocução recorrente e ativa com o time comercial da região para apresentação de performance, captura de oportunidades e correções de rota.

Como requisitos básicos, você deve ter:

  • Superior Completo em Administração, Marketing, Gestão Comercial e Comunicação;
  • Gestão de Equipe.

Será um diferencial:

  • Pós-graduação | MBA em gestão de negócios;
  • Visão estratégica;
  • Técnicas de Negociações (Intermediário/Avançado).

O que o Orbia Building & Infrastructure oferece?

Quer fazer a diferença trabalhando com um propósito? Aqui assumimos a responsabilidade uns pelos outros e pela nossa empresa. Continuamos corajosos na busca de riscos calculados que alimentam a inovação. E abraçamos a diversidade em perspectivas, habilidades e talentos para transformar a maneira como trabalhamos e o impacto que temos no mundo. Acima de tudo, incentivamos todos os nossos colaboradores a desenvolverem seus talentos e a se tornarem a melhor versão de si mesmos. Juntos, como uma equipe forte, crescemos e cumprimos nosso propósito todos os dias. Orbia B&I é o lugar para estar se você realmente deseja causar um impacto. Além de trabalhar com uma equipe profissional e entusiasmada em um ambiente internacional, oferecemos um pacote competitivo de remuneração e benefícios.

  • Garantimos 6 meses de licença maternidade e 20 dias de licença paternidade;
  • Durante a gestação, Isenção de qualquer tipo de cobrança de coparticipação de consultas e exames;
  • Auxílio creche durante os 03 primeiros anos da criança;
  • Todos os colaboradores efetivos e seus dependentes possuem convênio médico e pagamos 50% do valor dos medicamentos necessários para tratamentos;
  • Convênio odontológico para os colaboradores e suas famílias;
  • Convênio com a academia para garantir uma vida saudável;
  • Programa de Apoio Pessoal que oferece orientações de diversos profissionais como Psicólogos, Advogados, Nutricionistas, Fisioterapeutas e de Educadores Físicos, além de contar com orientações e dicas sobre finanças pessoais;
  • Refeição para os colaboradores, seja nos restaurantes internos nas fábricas ou vale refeição para o time de vendas e escritório corporativo;
  • Temos a disponibilidade de transporte fretado em várias unidades e oferecemos vale transporte quando necessário;
  • Para colaboradores e familiares, temos convênios educacionais com instituições de ensino;
  • Desconto em produtos da marca para reformar com a melhor opção do mercado;
  • E por último, mas não menos importante um dia de folga no seu aniversário!

title: Maestro Electricista
description:
¿Está interesado en convertirse en el maestro electricista con licencia para una empresa de servicios eléctricos residenciales en crecimiento?

Buscamos a la persona adecuada con una actitud positiva para unirse a nosotros en el desarrollo de una empresa de servicios de gran éxito.

Por qué debería unirse a nuestro equipo como maestro electricista

Su Licencia de Maestría en Electricidad y su experiencia pueden brindarle una manera de obtener ingresos sin estar involucrado en las operaciones diarias, y tiene la libertad de disfrutar su vida sin la presión de realizar tareas o asignaciones diarias.

Responsabilidades

Como maestro electricista, usted es un miembro clave de nuestro equipo. Estas son las principales responsabilidades de este puesto:

  1. Es posible que se requiera cierta participación en los permisos, preguntas relacionadas con el código y soluciones.
  2. Ayudar con el Pricebook incluyendo servicios y materiales. Después de su configuración inicial, se necesitarán más ediciones y actualizaciones del libro de precios caso por caso.

Cómo saber si eres una buena opción

Como maestro electricista de Mr. Electric:

  1. Te enfocas en lo positivo y disfrutas estar rodeado de personas optimistas.
  2. Cumples tus promesas al equipo.
  3. Eres detallista, tanto en tu trabajo como en la comunicación con el equipo.
  4. Eres profesional por naturaleza y eso se nota en todo lo que haces.
  5. Se siente cómodo con el uso de la tecnología.
  6. Le gusta conocer gente nueva y construir nuevas relaciones.
  7. Da la bienvenida a los comentarios y siempre está buscando mejorar sus habilidades.

Requisitos de trabajo

Los siguientes son los requisitos mínimos para el puesto de maestro electricista:

  1. Mínimo 6 años de experiencia previa en electricidad a nivel profesional.
  2. En posesión de una licencia de maestro electricista válida y aprobada por el estado.
  3. Licencia de conducir válida y registro de manejo limpio.

Pago y Beneficios

El pago se discutirá durante la entrevista. El primer paso es encontrar a la persona adecuada y encontrar la empresa adecuada con la que desarrollar una relación profesional continua.

Ofrecemos los siguientes beneficios para nuestros Maestros Electricistas:

(Para ser completado por ubicación)

Si está listo para dar el siguiente paso en su carrera como maestro electricista y desea unirse a un equipo en el que sea valorado y pueda sobresalir, ¡APLICA HOY!

title: Customer Operations Manager (f/m/d)
description:
Press Tab to Move to Skip to Content Link

Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:

Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:

At CARIAD, we're bundling and further expanding the Volkswagen Group's software expertise. We’re uniting over 6,500 global experts to build a scalable technology stack, including a software platform, unified electronic architecture and reliable connection to the automotive cloud. Our CARIDIANS are developing vehicle functions such as driver assistance systems, a next-generation infotainment platform, power electronics and charging technology, and digital services in and around the vehicle.
Our software can already be found in Volkswagen ID. models and will soon power Audi and Porsche vehicles with the E3 1.2 platform in 2024.
It's no easy task, but with experts like you, we can shape the future of mobility. Join us at CARIAD and be part of this exciting journey!

Questions about this position can be answered byMilly VWAG Blue at .

Brief Role Description

The role is responsible for leading the in-life Customer Operations functions to provide excellent customer service, brand alignment and compliance with all relevant regulatory and legal frameworks. The role owns all aspects of the delivery and development of the function in line with the company's business strategy.There is responsibility for developing customer service and for developing and executing the broader business strategy. A key objective is the consistent implementation of client strategies, policies and related procedures.The Director of Customer Operations exemplifies the value of the company and sets the standard for integrity by putting the customer at the center of everything we do, demonstrates ethical leadership in compliance and sets an example of consistency, fairness and transparency within the culture.

Possible Tasks within this role

Qualification requirements

  • Empathy (interpersonal relationship)
  • Customer Orientation
  • Leadership
  • Customer experience management
  • Customer communications management
  • Customer analytics
  • Strategic alignment
  • Brand (marketing)
  • Brand management
  • Compliance and ethics program
  • Governance, risk management, and compliance
  • Regulatory processes
  • Regulatory compliance
  • Regulatory requirements
  • Budget planning
  • Budget control

At CARIAD, we value individuality and diversity. We see great strength in our differences and can all benefit from the unique perspectives of others. We strive to employ people with diverse backgrounds who have the expertise, energy and focus to advance our mission. If you're unable to submit an application because of a disability, please contact us at .

title: Brazil: Administrative Assistant
description:
The Administrative Assistant will provide administrative support for executive management in Brazil in the areas of computer and internet research skills, project coordination, and working with cross-cultural relationships.

  • Read and analyze incoming memos, submissions, and reports in order to determine their significance and plan their distribution.
  • File and retrieve corporate documents, records, and reports.

#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: X-Ray Technician
description:
Description

Perform radiological duties in compliance with x-ray department and legal requirements. Help patients feel comfortable during the entire process. Perform selected nursing and administrative/clerical duties that assist in the delivery of primary health care and patient care management under the direction of a physician. These duties are delegated in relation to the individual's degree of training, in accordance with the objectives and policies of the organization and respective state laws governing such action and activities.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

X-Ray Technician:

  1. Prepare patients for radiological procedures and take X-rays following established procedures for patient care and safety.
  2. Protect patients, yourself and staff from radiation exposure by practicing sound procedures which meet or exceed recommended industry standards.
  3. Develop and process radiological film.
  4. Obtain quality diagnostic radiographs as requested by physicians. Maintain a repeat rate of two percent or less .
  5. Ensure that all equipment is in good working condition and in compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
  6. Report immediately any equipment malfunctions to Supervisor.
  7. Log completed radiological procedures. Complete paperwork accurately and on time.
  8. Identify and file reports as required.
  9. Maintain examination rooms. Stock necessary office and radiological supplies.
  10. Request, retrieve and track films to and from other departments or centers.
  11. Work closely with the physician to receive guidance and instruction for treating patients.

General:

  1. Compile and condense technical and statistical data for reports and records.
  2. Attend required meetings and participate in committees as requested.
  3. Complete appropriate documentation on all patients examined.
  4. Maintain appropriate communication and good interpersonal skills with Supervisors, staff and patients to ensure coordinated efforts and provision of high quality service.
  5. Utilize formal channels of communication to report concerns, personal requests and patient issues.
  6. Respect patients' right to privacy and confidentiality.
  7. Maintain an orderly and professional working atmosphere.
  8. Report to work properly dressed according to the approved dress code.
  9. Adhere to guidelines concerning working hours and break periods.
  10. Manage time effectively to complete all patient treatments and related activities as assigned.
  11. Maintain professional standards and procedures ensuring compliance with corporate policies and with applicable regulations.
  12. Perform related administrative duties as required.
  13. Take all necessary precautions to protect center assets and property against loss or waste through negligence or dishonesty.
  14. Demonstrate support to other co-workers by offering help.
  15. Assist in the solution of problems as directed by Supervisor.
  16. Perform related work as required.

Requirements

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

X-Ray Technician:

  1. Knowledge of anatomy and physiology sufficient to perform x-ray testing.
  2. Knowledge of radiology equipment.
  3. Skill in properly positioning patients.
  4. Skill in identifying equipment problems.
  5. Knowledge of safety hazards common to radiology including equipment, body mechanics, and patient movement.

General:

  1. Skill in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with patients, medical staff and the public.
  2. Knowledge of medical practice and organizational policies to administer patient care.
  3. Knowledge of examination and diagnostic procedures.
  4. Knowledge of use and maintenance of radiological equipment and instruments.
  5. Knowledge of common safety hazards and precautions to establish a safe work environment.
  6. Skill in documenting and maintaining patient care records.
  7. Skill in identifying and communicating problems to the supervisor.
  8. Skill in following medical quality assurance and quality control standards.
  9. Skill in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with patients and other staff.
  10. Ability to understand and follow verbal and written instructions.
  11. Ability to communicate clearly with patients and other staff.
  12. Good oral and written communication skills in English.
  13. Ability to react calmly and effectively in emergency situations and to work under high pressure situations.
  14. Good telephone manners and etiquette.
  15. Detail orientation and organization.
  16. Flexibility in working hours to handle variation in the inflow of patients and cover the needs of the department.

Education, Licenses/Certification

  1. High School Diploma or equivalent; completion of course in limited-scope/basic/LMRT/NCT radiological course; completion of medical assistant program.
  2. Limited/Basic/NCT/LMRT certification in Radiology preferred; certification obtained from an accredited Medical Assistant program preferred.

NOTE: This job description may not include all of the duties assigned to the employee and may be updated and modified by the department supervisor, according to the operations at any given time.

The base salary is determined on the candidate's education, qualifications, and experience, and is subject to change based on various internal and external factors.

Akeso is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Recruitment Coordinator
description:
4000 - 6000 BRL per month DOE plus commission and bonus

Title:  Recruitment Researcher / Recruitment Coordinator
Salary:  4000 - 6000 BRL per month DOE plus commission and bonus
Location:  Hybrid (Office & Home Working)
Status:  Full-Time

**To be considered for this position we require someone fluent in English, Portuguese, and either Spanish, German, French, Italian, or Dutch**

About Us

Oliver Carol Recruitment is an international recruitment provider to the global manufacturing sector. We focus on the CPG, OEM, Packaging, and Industrial Automation sectors specifically and have a physical presence in the USA, Europe, and Brazil.

About The Role

As a result of our expansion into the LATAM region, and in alignment with recent business growth we require several recruitment researchers to help support our recruitment efforts across North America, LATAM, and Europe.

You will be responsible for conducting research, market analysis, and candidate sourcing to ensure our clients have access to the best candidates for our exclusive recruitment mandates. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment whilst contributing to the success of our business and helping change the fortunes of our clients and candidates.

Key Responsibilities

  • Conduct market research to identify potential candidates, industries, and companies;
  • Utilize various sourcing methods, including online databases, social media, and professional networks, to identify and attract passive candidates;
  • Screen and assess candidates to ensure their qualifications align with client requirements;
  • Build and maintain a strong talent pipeline for current and future recruitment needs;
  • Collaborate with the recruitment team to develop and implement effective sourcing strategies;
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in recruitment and sourcing

The Person

You must be able to read, write, and speak the English language fluently as our business language is English. You will be requested to complete in-person tests to qualify for this.

Ideally, we are looking for someone with experience working within recruitment research and or candidate sourcing. However, we will happily talk to candidates with excellent communication and interpersonal skills, strong research, analytical IT skills, attention to detail, and an enthusiastic attitude and can-do mindset. We will also consider someone who has worked in a pre-sales environment.

You will be competent with MS Office - particularly Word, Outlook, and Excel.

We are offering a starting salary of 4000 - 6000 BRL per month, plus commission for successfully sourcing candidates that are placed with our clients and an end-of-year bonus.

We foresee that this role will develop into a consultant within our organization within 18 - 24 months.

If you are inquisitive, and investigative and have the required language and IT skills as well as a teachable personality we would love you to apply to this opportunity to join our growing team in our new office in Curitiba, Brazil!

#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Operations Readiness & Start Up Manager
description:
NES Fircroft has a unique opportunity for a senior-level Operations Readiness & Start Up Manager, supporting the integration of a portfolio of high value projects into operations at a giant producing oilfield in Iraq.

The assignment is on a 12-month renewable contract, working on a 28/28 rotation.

Role synopsis

Our client is undertaking a large number of brownfield and greenfield projects in order to support and enhance production over the coming years.

This already complex field will increase in complexity requiring the incumbent to manage a challenging set of dynamic issues in the integration of the new projects into existing sites and the engagement of the site operations staff will be critical in ensuring the success of Rumaila for the coming years.

There is significant value at stake for this role to successfully manage a large project portfolio in one of the world’s largest oil fields, which comes with associated exposure to senior management.

The role ensures that the operational interfaces between operation and projects are effectively managed and with synergies maximised.

Accountable for driving continuous improvement across the projects start up & stay up.

The Operations Readiness & Start Up Manager functions under the Operations Organisation, reporting to the Senior Operations Manager.

The role includes significant people leadership and stakeholder management in an organisation of significant scale and complexity.

Key Accountabilities

  • Operations Readiness and Start-Up Manager is accountable to support projects and operations, acting as an interface in delivery of operations readiness for projects in service of safe, reliable and compliant start-up in the field.
  • Accountable for projects’ start-up in the field and pre-requisite activities to enable safe and efficient operations.
  • Understanding and experience in Operations Readiness & Assurance (OR&A) Delivery Requirements and project stage Gate readiness;
  • Proactive engagement with all operating departments to ensure the development will integrate into existing Brownfield Assets;
  • Promote a culture of safety and continuous improvement.
  • Accountable to interface with Project Management team at earlier stage of the project to ensure provision of Operations and Commissioning inputs and planning are considered to deliver the project in accordance with the Scope of requirements (SOR).
  • Establish an O&M strategy for startup and earlier Operations phases and ensure strategy is reviewed and accepted by all project stakeholders.
  • Manage the delivery of all required operational support contracts (such as Chemicals / vendor support agreements) to support the Asset in the Operate phase.
  • Develop an Operations readiness plan (ORP) including the key readiness elements and O&M deliverables for the required project phases including commissioning and start up and earlier operations, ensure they are communicated in timely manner to project stakeholders,
  • Interface with the Contract and Finance departments for Contractor Performance and financial controls
  • Liaise closely with the Project Manager to manage the interfaces, ensure alignment, and Identify areas of improvement, best practices, and lessons learned from other similar projects and implement.
  • Manage & maintain focus on operability & maintainability issues throughout all aspects of the project design & execution planning.
  • Develop and monitor key performance Indicators to measure the effectiveness of the different phases of the O&M Scope.
  • Support the project assurance processes (such as Model Reviews / Hazop, Hazid, etc).
  • Manage the acceptance & handover from Project to Operations using the approved certification process (such Guidance OF Certification) ensuring a structured plan is developed in advance and implemented at the different project phases.
  • Ensure that Contractor documents (Plans, Manuals, procedures, and Method Statements) are reviewed and commented by Operations and readiness team members.
  • Ensure start up and ramp up plans are developed taking inputs from project stakeholders to ensure flawless delivery.
  • Work in close collaboration with the Contractor Commissioning and Start-up Team to ensure commissioning and start-up activities are planned and scheduled in line with the project standards and procedures. This includes establishing Flawless Start-up strategy and implementation of the program as per project.
  • Manage the HSSE performance of contractors during execution phases to ensure HSSE targets are met or exceeded – make HSSE a priority. Run contractor performance review on regular basis.

Criteria & Qualifications

  • BSc or BEng (UK), or international equivalent in an engineering discipline, or equivalent experience
  • Professional accreditation, such as Professional Engineer or Chartered Engineer
  • Minimum of 10 years of experience in operations or engineering role, with at least 5 years in a management or senior leadership position, with significant experience leading Readiness delivery on major projects, with emphasis on Middle East and preferably in Iraq.
  • Good understanding of project management, commissioning and start-up procedures and hand over projects to Operations.
  • Business focused, able to priorities to maximize opportunities with no compromise on HSE.
  • Deep understanding of all aspects of delivering Operational Excellence in a large asset.
  • Track record of visible Safety Leadership and demonstrable risk management skills, with clear knowledge and track record of Control of Work, HSE leadership and major incident control.
  • High awareness of safe working practices associated with FEED, design, construction, pre-commissioning, installation, hook- up and commissioning of oil & gas facilities.
  • Familiar with projects assurance processes such as hazard analysis methods such as HAZOP, HAZID / What-if, LOPA.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills demonstrated in the leadership of operating teams, influencing on contractors and change management.
  • Strong influencing skills and a track record of delivery, action-orientated and value-based decisions; ideally in a JV environment
  • Experience in overseas posting working with diverse cultures would be beneficial.

With over 90 years’ combined experience, NES Fircroft (NES) is proud to be the world’s leading engineering staffing provider spanning the Oil & Gas, Power & Renewables, Chemicals, Construction & Infrastructure, Life Sciences, Mining and Manufacturing sectors worldwide. With more than 80 offices in 45 countries, we are able to provide our clients with the engineering and technical expertise they need, wherever and whenever it is needed. We offer contractors far more than a traditional recruitment service, supporting with everything from securing visas and work permits, to providing market-leading benefits packages and accommodation, ensuring they are safely and compliantly able to support our clients.

title: Contracts and Procurement Specialist - Service and Equipment, Hortolândia
description:
Contracts and Procurement Specialist - Service and Equipment, Hortolândia

  • Full-time

At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.

Every day we help our major global clients deliver ambitious and highly technical projects, in over 125 offices worldwide.

We are currently looking for an experienced Contract & Procurement Specialist to join our Real Estate business in São Paulo, working on an exciting project.

With strong experience in a consultancy or contractor organization, you will have knowledge and demonstrate hands-on experience of standard forms of contract, claims management, dispute avoidance and/or dispute resolution within the natural resources, energy and/or infrastructure environment sectors.

The Contract & Procurement Specialist will represent the Client’s commercial interests while overseeing procurement activities by third party partner organizations.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Contract management: supplier follow-up, contract close-out and ensure contract compliance.
  • Ensure that business goals are accomplished by contract implementation.
  • Provide regular reporting on the status of contracts for management.
  • Stakeholder management – the ability to create and maintain strong relationships with your different client interfaces.
  • Prepare or review requests for proposals for distribution to vendors.
  • Coordinate with Project Controls and the finance department to ensure correct billing and accounts payable. Verify receipt of goods and services and help verify quality performance by vendors.
  • Identify potential improvements to contracting and procurement strategies, policies, bidding, and vendor selection to achieve the best value for the Client.
  • Be an active member of the procurement organization and contract team.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Very strong and relevant experience in a similar role in the Real Estate construction sector.
  • Commercial project experience highly preferred.
  • Formal Project Management methods.
  • Excellent problem-solving, critical thinking and analytical skills.
  • Ability to present to senior management to gain approvals.
  • Detail oriented with strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced and quickly changing environment.

At Turner & Townsend we want our people to succeed in both work and life, we promote a healthy, productive and flexible environment. In addition, you can expect.

It is strictly against Turner & Townsend policy for candidates to pay any fee in relation to our recruitment process. No recruitment agency working with Turner & Townsend will ask candidates to pay a fee at any time.

Any unsolicited resumes/CVs submitted through our website or to Turner & Townsend personal e-mail accounts, are considered property of Turner & Townsend and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorised Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Turner & Townsend, there must be a formal written agreement in place and the agency must be invited, by the Recruitment Team, to submit candidates for review.

#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Talent Acquisition Executive, Sao Paulo
description:
We are looking for a Talent Acquisition Executive to join our team in Sao Paulo and help us attract and develop top talent across US cities. You will focus on bringing on-board amazing people that will love our culture and embrace our values. If you are a target-driven professional, who has a passion for attracting great talent and creating an exceptional candidate experience, this is an opportunity to drive your career forward!

What you will focus on:

  • Mass/Volume Recruitment:
    • Lead and manage high-volume recruitment campaigns for roles in our Ops teams across US cities.
    • Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract a large pool of qualified candidates.
  • Sourcing and Candidate Management:
    • Utilize a variety of sourcing methods including job boards, social media, community outreach, and referral programs.
    • Maintain a robust pipeline of candidates to ensure a steady flow of applicants for ongoing hiring needs.
    • Manage candidate relationships and provide an exceptional candidate experience throughout the recruitment process
  • Agency Collaboration:
    • Partner with recruitment agencies to supplement internal sourcing efforts and ensure timely fulfillment of hiring needs.
    • Negotiate and manage agency contracts, ensuring alignment with company standards and budget.
    • Act as the primary point of contact for agency partners, fostering strong, collaborative relationships.
  • Be a Blueground Ambassador: Get people excited about Blueground and match great talent to great opportunities. You will often be the first person that someone talks to from Blueground, so you need to be great at understanding what motivates them and match their motivations with the many benefits of working here.
  • Collaborative Hiring Process: Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and relevant stakeholders, ensuring a seamless interview process for candidates. Facilitate candidate feedback sessions and debrief meetings to gather input and make informed hiring decisions. Work closely with HR teams to manage offer negotiations, pre-employment checks, and onboarding processes.

What we are looking for:

  • 6+ years of experience in talent acquisition, with a focus on multi-state high-volume hiring for operational/field roles.
  • Experience in partnering and collaborating with external recruitment agencies.
  • Tech-savvy and familiar with our tools/systems: Greenhouse or other Applicant Tracking System, Google Suite, and Slack.
  • Candidate experience focused, passionate about being creative in our approach to sourcing talent.
  • Excellent organizational and prioritization skills, tenacious, personable, and articulate.
  • Ability to establish trusted relationships with management, candidates, and external partners.
  • Positive attitude combined with a desire to make work fun.

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary & annual performance bonus

title: Senior Telecoms Business Analyst (BSS/CRM)
description:
If digital transformation , next generation technology  and growth opportunities  excite you, then apply to join our Netcracker Technology  Team! Our culture  and collaborative work environment  are the keys to our success. Here you will work with the best in class global teams , earn a competitive salary  and contribute to the largest digital transformations happening around the world. .

What is in it for you?

At Netcracker, we are all entrepreneurs. This means we get creative when thinking of technical solutions, we explore possibilities and innovations and get excited about new technology. We take complete ownership of our roles and aren’t micromanaged or left feeling like just another number. The results we achieve are highly visible to our leadership team and we are recognized for our work and promoted accordingly.

What is the scope of this role?

Netcracker Technology is looking to hire a Senior Business Analyst to join our Implementation Engineering teams located throughout the LATAM region. As a CRM/BSS Domain technological subject matter expert (SME), you will be responsible for leading a team providing cost effective solution to business and technical challenges faced in large/complex Telecommunication projects. Business Analysts are working as a company’s representatives in front of the enterprise customer. You will be responsible for providing guidance to the leadership service provider to better understanding and articulate the challenges. Then define and document measurable criteria for solution assessment, proposing solution(s) and bring best practice. It is expected that you will have recognition in the Telecommunication industry as a CRM or BSS Domain SME.

  • As an experienced Business Analyst, you will be focused on ensuring the quality of business requirements for enterprise client. You will provide "best practice" in understanding the client requirements, Telecom products and network aspects in order to align the business’s needs.
  • The key element of the role is focused on analysis, project design, which can be delivered thought the baseline capabilities of existing product. Most important - stakeholder management as well as expectation management.
  • Collecting and collating business requirements for Business-to-Business telecom products on various network technologies.
  • Guiding and coaching the business stakeholders through the requirements gathering process.
  • Provide clarification and act as a point of reference for business requirement inquiries by solution design and project delivery teams.
  • Work with project teams agreeing approach and keeping them informed of progress.
  • Facilitate workshops required to understand and outcome, detailed requirements, and solution behavior.
  • Work closely with delivery team to ensure functional and non-functional completeness of the solution
  • Create comprehensive and unambiguous documentation that outlines requirement of stakeholder, traceable for testing team and understandable for development team. Develop comprehensive knowledge of the aligned business area and the trust of its business stakeholders.

What skills and experience will you need for this role?

  • 5+ years of sufficient technical knowledge to understand high-level architecture and technical requirements around BSS/OSS/CRM solutions for Telecoms projects.
  • Experience with next gen CRM and Converged Billing applications (CPQ, Order Management, Product Catalo,etc).
  • Strong business analysis background, preferably in an internet/software development company.
  • Fluent with English & Portuguese languages. 
  • Organizational skills, able to work simultaneously on a number of assignments when required.
  • Knowledge of business analysis principles and methodologies.
  • Proven ability to work BSS/OSS functionally to drive the accurate capture of requirement, resolving and closing down issues and information shortfall as and when they appear.
  • Experience of working within Waterfall & Agile methodology.
  • Ability to collaborate and solve challenges.
  • Proven experience of successfully working within transformation projects, or projects with environment B2B products
  • Previous experience leading architecture teams 
  • Availability to work from the office on a Hybrid mode (at least 3 times per week)

 Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field

Who is Netcracker Technology?
We are a forward-looking software company, offering mission-critical solutions to service providers around the globe. Our comprehensive portfolio of software solutions and professional services enables large-scale digital transformations, unlocking the opportunities of the cloud, analytics, virtualization, and 5G mobile networks. With an unbroken service delivery track record of more than 25 years, our unique combination of technology, people and expertise helps companies transform their networks and enable better experiences for their customers.

Connect with us on LinkedIn and stay up to date on our company news.

title: Procurement and Logistics Associate
description:
Program Overview : Chemonics International, a US-based international development consulting firm, seeks a Procurement and Logistics Specialist for the USAID Iraq Together project. Iraq Together aims to provide more equitable, efficient, and sustainable public services in Iraq, as well as improving government responsiveness to citizens’ needs and demands. Objectives of this project include working with the Government of Iraq (GOI) to improve service delivery and strengthen democratic and participatory governance.

Position Overview: The Procurement and Logistics Associate will be responsible for leading the technical and operational procurement processes on Iraq Together, in coordination with the Operations Director and their team. The individual will ensure quality standards are met, and all procurements are cost-effective and compliant with USAID rules and regulations, Chemonics policies and procedures, and Iraqi government laws. This role will oversee the full procurement cycle, including support to the program teams as required, and lead the logistical operations of the project activities and office facilities. This position is open to Iraqi nationals residing in Baghdad, Iraq.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Preserve the integrity of the procurement process, including drafting project procurement documents including all solicitations, negotiation memos, consents to subcontract, and applicable waivers.
  • Maintain organized and concise procurement files that document project compliance with USAID rules and regulations, Chemonics policies and procedures, as well as local, third country, or US government rules that affect the procurement process.
  • Provide guidance to technical and operational staff on procurement/compliance policies, in particular those contained in FAR, CFR, ADS, and AIDAR regulating procurement.
  • Enforce clear and transparent procurement procedures.
  • Work directly with local, regional, or international vendors and service providers to obtain quotations and/or to conduct procurements of commodities or services.
  • Monitor contracts and purchase orders and conduct follow-up as necessary to ensure compliance with terms and conditions.
  • Compile all required documentation to facilitate payment requests.
  • Organize and participate in internal evaluation committees.
  • Monitor for any procurement-related conflict of interest and ensure the project’s procurement process is open and transparent.
  • Work with project leadership to answer any questions or provide USAID with any requested information about project procurements.
  • Other duties as assigned by the supervisor.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field required.
  • Minimum of three (3) years of procurement, subcontracts and grants required.
  • Experience working for USAID or other donor funded projects strongly preferred.
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of procurement procedures of international organizations.
  • Strong organizational, management, and administrative skills.
  • Willingness and ability to work efficiently and respectfully with a diverse group of people.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, in particular Excel, Word, SharePoint, and Outlook.
  • Demonstrated leadership, versatility, and integrity.
  • Proficiency in written and oral Arabic and English is required; written and oral fluency in Kurdish, and other local languages is a plus, but not required.

Application Instructions:

To apply please fill out this form: Iraq Together Job Application Form (smartsheet.com).

Chemonics is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in its selection and employment practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, or other non-merit factors.

title: Job Opportunity – Well Site Geologist
description:
• Full responsibility for the quality control of geological data acquisition, including proper calibration of logging equipment prior to deployment.
    Full responsibility and ownership for providing the rig-site interface between geological and drilling department requirements.
    Report and advise the Operator of well conditions during all drilling related wellsite operations.
    Understand and be aware of the geological implications during all wellsite operations.
  • Manage the operator’s reporting database (RWEB) and ensure the quality and integrity of the well data acquired. All data pertaining to the well such as gas log, mudlog, etc. provided by the vendor to be QC prior to upload in the database system (RWEB).
  • Ensure timely communication of pertinent data to operations people on the rig and in town.
  • Evaluate as required, mudlogging, wireline and LWD/PWD data at the wellsite, providing detailed evaluations to town as requested.
  • Be familiar with PETRONAS & MP HSSE requirements.
  • Be aware of safety regulations and procedures as specified by the Company, Mudlogging, LWD/PWD and Wireline Logging Contractors, and relevant safety authorities. Respect safety regulations in all circumstances and ensure that all personnel under supervision do the same.
  • Implement all requirements to maintain a quality service within the scope of operations. The major objective is to provide the best services in order to meet and/or exceed Company’s satisfaction.

Job Requirements:

  • A degree in Geosciences, Geophysics or Geology.
  • An excellent understanding of mudlogging, LWD/PWD and wireline logging tools, equipment, operations and acquisition, as well as drilling and upstream processes.
  • A thorough understanding of carbonate reservoir classification and evaluation techniques.
  • At least 6 months’ experience in PMCD drilling operations and evaluation.
  • A minimum of 10 years wellsite experience with a minimum of 5 years as a wellsite geologist, most of which should be offshore. At least 5 years wellsite experience in mudlogging and pressure engineering disciplines are desired to fulfill the position as a consulting Wellsite Geologist.
  • Must have previous experience with mudlogging, field services (LWD or Wireline Engineer) companies or with an Oil and Gas Operator.
    Experience in PMCD operations is required.
    Experience with Pore Pressure and Fracture Gradient prediction is required.
    Experience in carbonate classification, interpretation and drilling operations is required.
  • Observation and investigation skills.
  • G&G software skills, specifically the RWEB reporting database application, would be highly desirable.
  • Mathematical and numerical ability.

If you are interested in applying for this position, please submit your updated CV to or email to ASAP.

We thank you very much in advance to all applicants; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Product Lead
description:
Sobre o Stark Bank

Você se imagina trabalhando em uma empresa que antecipa o futuro simplificando o presente? Esse é o Stark Bank, fintech focada em médias e grandes empresas que vem crescendo exponencialmente no Brasil.

Nascemos em 2018 e oferecemos a melhor tecnologia financeira para pagamentos e recebimentos. Temos contas para empresas, gestão de caixa, cartões corporativos, transferências eletrônicas, invoices, linhas de crédito e investimentos.

Atualmente, respondemos por 8% do total de transações Pix para PJ no Brasil e ajudamos as empresas a escalarem suas operações com controle, inteligência de dados e eficiência operacional.

Em 2022, tivemos um aporte de US$ 45 milhões, com a participação da Bezos Expeditions. Somos a primeira startup brasileira a receber investimentos de Jeff Bezos, o fundador da Amazon.

Também somos uma empresa listada pela YCombinator como uma das mais valiosas do mundo em seu ranking anual.

Buscamos pessoas que entendam como encantar clientes internos e externos, queiram quebrar recordes e fazer história. Admiramos os curiosos, consistentes e persistentes.


Você irá:
  • Ser responsável por articular e comunicar efetivamente os objetivos, estratégias e valor dos produtos desenvolvidos dentro da empresa.
  • Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com equipes multidisciplinares para garantir a entrega de produtos de alta qualidade e alto impacto.
  • Ser o "dono" dos produtos, garantindo sua viabilidade, usabilidade e sucesso no mercado.
  • Desenvolver produtos desde o conceito até a entrega, com foco na excelência técnica e na experiência do cliente.
  • Ser proativo e "mão na massa", envolvendo-se diretamente no desenvolvimento e na resolução de problemas.
Esperamos que você:
  • Tenha experiência comprovada no desenvolvimento de aplicativos e produtos digitais, preferencialmente no setor financeiro.
  • Demonstre habilidades excepcionais de comunicação e colaboração para trabalhar eficazmente com equipes multifuncionais.
  • Seja fluente em inglês, tanto oral quanto escrito, para se comunicar com colegas e stakeholders globais.
  • Possua uma mentalidade centrada no cliente, priorizando suas necessidades e expectativas ao desenvolver produtos.
O que não pode faltar:
  • Capacidade de tomar decisões assertivas e orientadas por dados, considerando o impacto de longo prazo dos produtos.
  • Forte habilidade de resolução de problemas, com um foco contínuo na inovação e na melhoria dos produtos.
  • Adaptabilidade e flexibilidade para trabalhar em um ambiente dinâmico e em constante evolução.
  • Pensamento estratégico e visão holística, considerando não apenas os aspectos técnicos, mas também os comerciais e de experiência do usuário.
  • Paixão por tecnologia e produtos digitais, com um desejo de estar na vanguarda da inovação no setor financeiro.

Nulinga (para aprender inglês e crescer com a empresa);

Convênio com o SESC;

Bônus anual.

Trabalhamos no modelo presencial e estamos localizados na Rua Pamplona - Cerqueira César, São Paulo - SP!

We are seeking a motivated CRM Specialist to join our growing business. This role will manage key accounts across Brazil and Chile, driving the performance of Apple products across sales channels. You will negotiate, plan, and implement base management projects with eCommerce, Carriers, Premium, and Omnichannel Retailers.
